name: Abdel Omerna
info: A Child of the Light. He is tall and commanding with a bold, fearless face and a strong chin. There are waves of white hair at his temples. He has dark eyes. He is the “spymaster” for the Whitecloaks, although he is a decoy; even he does not know that the the real Master of Spies is [Sebban Balwer](#Sebban-Balwer).

name: Abell Cauthon
info: [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s father. He and his wife [Natti](#Natti-Cauthon) live in Emond's Field with their two unmarried daughters [Eldrin](#Eldrin-Cauthon) and [Bodewhin](#Bodewhin-Bode-Cauthon). They have two other daughters. Abell is excellent with a bow and arrow, and is in general a really nice guy; Mat does not know of anyone that dislikes him. His children are about the age where they start to leave home—twenty, seventeen, and sixteen for Mat, Eldrin, and Bode respectively.

name: Adeleas Namelle
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah, one of two Aes Sedai who went into voluntary retreat many years ago to Tifan's Well, a village located in the grassy plains of Arafel along with [Vandene](#Vandene-Namelle). Their goal some day is to write the complete history of the world since the Breaking, and some even before that. She is now in Salidar, and will accompany [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) to Ebou Dar.

name: Aeron
info: Wise One who [Sorilea](#Sorilea) sends to search the Royal Library of Cairhien. Her apprentice is named [Estair](#Estair).

name: Afara
info: Aes Sedai who went to Tarabon to attempt to help restore order there.

name: Aginor
info: One of the Forsaken. During the Age of Legends, he was one of the foremost biologists of his time, specializing in genetics. He went over to the Shadow because only there could he do all of the experiments he wanted to. He was the one who created the Trollocs, Dragkhar, _gholam_, Darkhounds, and other Shadowspawn. Some of the other Forsaken think he was insane, for only someone insane would create some of the creatures he did. He was the second one to be released from the sealing on the Bore, after [Balthamel](#Balthamel). He was trapped close to the surface of the Bore, so he was not shielded from the passing of time very effectively; he emerged as a very old man, so old that his face was wrinkled so that one could barely make out his features anymore. He was killed by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) at the Eye of the World.

name: Akarrin
info: Slim Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She is convinced that [Aviendha](#Aviendha) will be in novice white before long.

name: Alanna Mosvani
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She is dark and slender with black hair and dark eyes. She has one surviving Warder, [Ihvon](#Ihvon); her other, [Owein](#Owein), died in the Two Rivers while scouting the Whitecloak camp. She thinks that [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), and [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) should be bonded as Warders to “keep an eye on them.”

name: Alric
info: [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche)'s Warder for about twenty years. He was killed when Siuan was deposed; the shock of what [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) intended to do masked the usual emotions that accompany the death of a Warder for her at first, and when she was stilled she lost all contact with the destroyed bond. However, when she was Healed, all the emotions came rushing back to her.

name: Alsbet Luhhan
info: Wife of [Haral](#Haral-Luhhan), the blacksmith of Emond's Field. She is almost as large as her husband, which is quite big.

name: Aludra
info: Slender former Illuminator that [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) saved from other Illuminators when they were traveling through Aringill. She was cast out of the Illuminators' Guild because she was blamed for spoiling the fireworks display for [King Galldrian](#King-Galldrian-su-Riatin-Rie) of Cairhien. The problem was actually Tammuz's fault (or so they thought), but she was a more convenient target. The mishap for Galldrian was actually caused by [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor). Aludra later hooked up with Valan Luca's menagerie to do fireworks displays for him.

name: Alviarin Freidhen
info: Aes Sedai of the White Ajah, but secretly of the Black. Typical of most Whites, she has a very cool, collected personality. She serves as [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) under [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan), despite being of a different Ajah than Elaida was raised from. Elaida was all but forced to choose Alviarin in order to gain the support of the White Ajah when bringing charges against [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche).

name: Alwin Rael
info: Man who tickled the chin of one of [Lady Arilyn](#Lady-Arilyn-Dhulaine)'s maids.

name: Amar
info: An Ogier; she is [Coura](#Coura)'s daughter and [Elora](#Elora)'s mother.

name: Amaryn
info: [Sorilea](#Sorilea)'s greatdaughter.

name: Amyrlin Seat
info: Leader of the Aes Sedai, their equivalent of a King or Queen. She in theory holds supreme power amongst the sisters, and leads the Hall of the Tower at its meetings. Kings and queens of nations strong and weak will come if summoned by the Amyrlin, even if they spend their entire trip figuring out how they will put a knife in her back while there. The Seat is traditionally held by a woman strong both in the Power and in her character. The vote to choose an Amyrlin must be unanimous, as must the vote to depose one. Once chosen the Amyrlin is said to be “of all Ajahs and none”—all previous affiliations with Ajah are ignored (at least in theory). The Ajahs get fairly equal numbers of Amyrlins raised from their Ajah, with two exceptions: no Amyrlin has been raised from the Red Ajah since Bonwhin, who was deposed and stilled for nearly breaking the Tower in [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing)'s day, except for [Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan), the current Amyrlin Seat in Tar Valon; the Blue Ajah has had more than the average number of Amyrlins from its Ajah—four of the last the last five Amyrlins (before Elaida) were raised from the Blue Ajah. These two exceptions to the mean number of Amyrlins from one's Ajah have only added to the friction between the Blue and Red Ajahs over the years. The Amyrlin has a secretary of sorts, the [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles), who is traditionally chosen from the same Ajah that the Amyrlin was raised from. The office was held by [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), raised from the Blue Ajah, until she was deposed for her involvement with events surrounding the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). Her successor was the leader of the coup, Elaida, raised from the Red Ajah. Siuan's deposition divided the Tower, and the faction opposing Elaida plans to raise its own Amyrlin.

name: Amys
info: Wise One of the Nine Valleys sept of the Taardad Aiel. [Rhuarc](#Rhuarc)'s wife (one of two). She is one of the Wise Ones that trained [Aviendha](#Aviendha) and [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere).

name: Anaiya
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. She has blunt, motherly facial features. She was very good friends with [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) both as a novice and as a full sister. She, like all Blues, fled the Tower when [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) was raised to the Striped Stole, and now carries a position of considerable influence in the “Little Tower” in Salidar.

name: Anarina Todande
info: Last of five rulers of Altara from House Todande. Her fall was so abrupt that her house lost all of its power, and is still all but powerless to this day.

name: Andris
info: [Sammael](#Sammael)'s messenger to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) about a truce. He was sent there to die; how he died indicated to Sammael that Rand was not willing to offer a truce.

name: Angla
info: One of the Accepted. She was part of [Anaiya](#Anaiya)'s link during the bubble of evil that passed through Salidar.

name: Anjen
info: [Leane](#Leane-Sharif)'s Warder until his death about fifteen years ago. She says that she cried every night for a month after his death, and found tears in her eyes without warning for three months more. For this reason, she did not bond another Warder. However, she now thinks she could handle two or three Warders, if not four.

name: Aram
info: Former Tuatha'an who gave up the Way of the Leaf to learn the sword when the Trollocs killed his mother. He learned from [Tam al'Thor](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor), [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s father and a Blademaster, and picked it up extremely fast.

name: Aran'gar
info: Name given to the reincarnation of one of the Forsaken. It was the right-hand dagger in a form of dueling popular right after the creation of the Bore. The sport fell from common practice, since almost invariably both duelists died from the slow poison on the daggers.

name: Areina Nermasiv
info: A dark-haired woman about two years younger than [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara). She imitates [Birgitte](#Birgitte).

name: Artur Hawkwing
info: Name by which [Artur Paendrag Tanreall](#Artur-Hawkwing) was known after his rise to power.

name: Arwin
info: One of the Younglings.

name: Arymilla Marne
info: Brown-eyed Andoran noble with an eye for [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). She has a habit of fainting. She opposed [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession.

name: Ashmanaille
info: Lanky Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah.

name: Asidim Faisar
info: Whitecloak who [Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall) sent to Tarabon to find out if anything could be salvaged.

name: Asmodean
info: One of the Forsaken. He was born Joar Addam Nessosin in the then coastal city of Shorelle, a child prodigy in music and art. He gave his life to the Shadow in exchange for the immortality he received, so he could study and perfect his music. After being released from the Bore, he was coerced by [Lanfear](#Lanfear) into coming with her, eventually to teach [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) to channel without killing himself. Asmodean was drawn to Rhuidean and the stash of _angreal_, _ter'angreal_, and most especially the two white statue _ter'angreal_ that linked the holder to the great _sa'angreal_ buried near Cairhien and on Tremalking, which together could Break the World beyond repair. He went there to obtain the male statue, but was thwarted by Rand, who severed his bonds to the [Dark One](#Dark-One). He then became Rand's teacher, and went into hiding from the rest of the Chosen, who would kill him on sight if they saw him. He was killed by someone of yet unknown identity right after [Rahvin](#Rahvin) and Lanfear were killed/trapped.

name: Asra
chapter: Chapter 51: The TakingChapter 52: Weaves of the Power
info: Woman who tries to save [Masic](#Masic)'s life. She can channel, and used Healing on Masic; he died from the strain of healing. She was born in Arad Doman.

name: Atalin
info: A plump woman, one of [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s servants.

name: Avar Hachami
chapter: Chapter 51: The TakingChapter 52: Weaves of the Power
info: One of [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari)'s Warders.

name: Avendesora
info: The Legendary Tree of Life. It is the last surviving Chora tree, and is located in Rhuidean. The Tree was severely damaged when [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Asmodean](#Asmodean) battled over control of the _ter'angreal_ statue and destroyed the shielding on Rhuidean, but it is still alive and will send out shoots again. A cutling of the Tree was given to the people of Cairhien as a sign of goodwill from the Aiel over 500 years ago. That Tree, _[Avendoraldera](#Avendoraldera)_, grew in the center of the city of Cairhien until [King Laman Damodred](#King-Laman-Damodred) cut it down to make a throne out of the wood. Laman's Sin (as it is now called) brought four Aiel clans over the Spine of the World to kill Laman for killing the Tree.

name: Avendoraldera
info: A chora tree, cut from _[Avendesora](#Avendesora)_, the legendary Tree of Life, which was given as a gift to the people of Cairhien from the Aiel. The Cairhienin never knew exactly why the Aiel gave them such a gift, and almost five hundred years later it was almost forgotten that it _was_ a gift from them. The tree, which grew in the center of the city of Cairhien, was cut down by [King Laman Damodred](#King-Laman-Damodred) twenty years ago, which precipitated the Aiel War. Four clans of the Aiel crossed the Dragonwall under the leadership of [Janduin](#Janduin), [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s father and chief of the Taardad Aiel, to punish Laman for his sin. The deep respect the Aiel held for the Cairhienin, as well as the passage through the Waste they were allowed, was terminated after Laman's Sin—the Aiel now refer to all Cairhienin as “treekillers,” and think nothing of killing or mistreating them.

name: Aviendha
info: Aiel of the Nine Valleys sept of the Taardad Aiel. Formerly a Maiden of the Spear, she was forced to give up the spear to become a Wise One because she had the ability to channel inborn. She has green eyes, and is of age with [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). She is more than pretty with dark, reddish hair. Aviendha is one of the three women in [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw)'s viewing of Rand—she also saw that she was to fall in love with him when she went through the three rings in Rhuidean. She denied her feelings for him at first, but when the wagons crossed the Dragonwall toward Cairhien, sweat tents became unavailable and she tried bathing as “wetlanders” did; Rand came in as she was standing before the bath in her skin, and she panicked. She created a Traveling gateway to Seanchan (she does not remember how), trying to get as far away from Rand as possible, into the middle of winter. When Rand rescued her, she decided she could not hide her feelings any longer, and the two ended up spending the night in each other's arms before coming back. Aviendha says a similar incident will not occur, and punishes any Maiden who makes a crack about it (how they found out about something that occurred on the far side of the world on another continent is a different subject entirely). She feels _toh_ toward [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) for violating her trust, and denies her feelings for Rand until she can make it up to Elayne. She is often needled by the Maidens about liking Rand's eyebrows.

name: Azril
info: A serving maid in Culain's Hound, the inn where [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin), [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani), and the girls stay in Caemlyn.

name: Ba'alzamon
info: Name used by [Ishamael](#Ishamael) during the long years he was only half-imprisoned in the Bore. It means “Heart of the Dark” in the Old Tongue.

name: Bael
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: Clan chief of the Goshien Aiel. He is the tallest man [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) has ever met, almost a head taller than Rand, who is not short. He has deep, resonant voice. He has two wives: [Dorindha](#Dorindha), and [Melaine](#Melaine). Melaine and Bael were recently wed, after Dorindha agreed to accept Melaine as a sister-wife. He has three sons (by Dorindha), and is expecting twin daughters (by Melaine).

name: Baerin
info: Aiel, in Cairhien to see her daughter. She was a Maiden of the Spear before she gave it up to get married.

name: Bain
info: A Maiden of the Spear of the Black Rock sept of the Shaarad Aiel. She has flame-colored hair. She is first-sister to [Chiad](#Chiad), of the Goshien Aiel; the two had to sneak through the camp of the other to find the Wise Ones to become first sisters, since their clans were in blood feud at the time.

name: Bair
info: Wise One of the Haido sept of the Shaarad Aiel. She is a Dreamwalker, and was one of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s teachers. She has been married before, but her husbands are dead.

name: Balinor
info: [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani)'s first Warder. It took her ten years to get over his death and bond [Ihvon](#Ihvon).

name: Ballair
info: Aes Sedai of unknown Ajah, advisor to [Queen Ishara](#Queen-Ishara-Maravaile) of Andor. She was the first royal advisor to be Aes Sedai.

name: Balthamel
info: One of the Forsaken. He was the first of the Forsaken to be released from the sealing. He was trapped very close to the surface of the Bore, and thus not shielded very effectively from the passage of time; he emerged so deformed by age that he had to hide his face behind a cloth and unable to speak with his own tongue. He was killed by the Green Man at the Eye of the World.

name: Bandry (Ban) Lewin
info: [Dannil Lewin](#Dannil-Lewin)'s cousin. He looks jut like him except for a pickaxe nose and long thin mustaches in the Domani style.

name: Baran
info: [Merana](#Merana-Ambrey)'s Warder. He died before the Aiel War, and she never bonded another due to the apprehension and fear his death caused.

name: Barasine
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah who allegedly approached [Logain](#Logain-Ablar) before he proclaimed himself. She did a lot of the talking in [Javindhra](#Javindhra-Doraille)'s group.

name: Bari
info: Palace worker in Caemlyn who announces the arrival of [Elder Haman](#Elder-Haman), [Covril](#Covril), and [Erith](#Erith), the three Ogier who come to Caemlyn. He has been in the Palace for 22 years.

name: Barid Bel Medar
info: Name that [Demandred](#Demandred) was born with and used during the Age of Legends (before dedicating his life to serve the [Dark One](#Dark-One)).

name: Baris
chapter: Chapter 51: The TakingChapter 52: Weaves of the Power
info: Man who killed [Masic](#Masic) in a knife fight on the streets of Ebou Dar.

name: Bartol
info: One of [Erian](#Erian-Boroleos)'s two surviving Warders (she had four until two were killed by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)).

name: Basan
info: [Merana](#Merana-Ambrey)'s Warder. He died before the Aiel War, and she never bonded another due to the apprehension and fear his death caused.

name: Basel Gill
info: Pink-cheeked man with graying hair who follows [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand). He was the innkeeper of the Queen's Blessing, an inn in Caemlyn which at one time housed [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) while they were waiting for [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) and the rest of the group to catch up to them.

name: Be'lal
info: One of the Forsaken. He was killed by [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) in the Stone of Tear, just before [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) took _Callandor_. Since he was destroyed by balefire, he is completely dead—not even the [Dark One](#Dark-One) himself can bring him back.

name: Beira
info: One of [Bair](#Bair)'s _gai'shain_. She refuses to put off the white despite being beaten until Bair's arm is sore.

name: Bela
info: Short, shaggy mare that [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) rode out of Emond's Field when she first left with [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) and [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran). Bela actually belongs to [Tam al'Thor](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor), and [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) suggested her as a way to take Egwene with them. [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) rode her out of Tar Valon in the chaos surrounding [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan)'s coup.

name: Beldeine Nyram
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She arrived in Cairhien separate from the original six-Aes Sedai embassy.

name: Beldemaine
info: Plump Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She is from Arafel. In Salidar.

name: Benji Dalfor
info: One of the Younglings. He is barely old enough to have to shave regularly. He has a scar on his cheek that he got while fighting in the Tower.

name: Beonin Marinye
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. She is pretty, has honey-colored hair, and grew up in Tarabon. Her blue-gray eyes seem to constantly look startled. Nothing seems to surprise her, though, and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) thinks she would not believe the sun would come up unless she saw it herself, and if one morning it did not, she would just take it to confirm that she was correct to demand proof. She is one of the six sisters in Salidar that have most of the authority, despite not being part of the Hall of the Tower.

name: Bera Harkin
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She has three Warders. She was sent, along with [Kiruna](#Kiruna-Nachiman), to establish diplomatic relations with [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) in the Aiel Waste. She grew up in Andor.

name: Beralna
info: A Maiden of the Spear. She is a bony redhead with blue eyes and a feral grin.

name: Berelain sur Paendrag Paeron
info: The First of Mayene, their equivalent of a Queen. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) put her in charge of Cairhien along with [Rhuarc](#Rhuarc). She is fond of wearing the latest fashion in dresses, and those are usually quite revealing. She has her eyes on many men, but [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) foremost—she is presumed to be [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw)'s hawk in her viewings of Perrin. She is a very capable ruler. Rhuarc and the Wise Ones seem to treat her as a long-lost daughter or younger sister, much to the confusion of other “wetlanders.”

name: Berenicia Morsad
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She grew up in Shienar. Part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Beslan Mitsobar
info: [Queen Tylin](#Queen-Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar)'s only surviving child. She wants him to succeed her on the throne.

name: Betse Silvin
info: Serving maid at the Golden Stag. She is stout and slim with dark eyes, pale cheeks, and black curly hair of shoulder length. She has a precise, musical voice. [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) dances with her for much of a night.

name: Bharatine
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She is rail-thin and has a long nose.

name: Birgitte
info: Hero of Legend, bound to the Horn of Valere until [Moghedien](#Moghedien) ripped her away. She has long blonde hair that she keeps in a braid, and is one of the best with bow and arrows. During [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara)'s struggle with Moghedien, Birgitte was ripped out of _Tel'aran'rhiod_ and almost died. She would have if she had not been saved by [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), who bonded her has a Warder to give her the strength and quick healing she needed to survive. She is always linked to [Gaidal Cain](#Gaidal-Cain) in the stories, and misses him immensely since he was spun out normally while she was ripped out. She is nothing like the stories say she is supposed to be like.

name: Bodewhin (Bode) Cauthon
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s younger sister, now seventeen. She comes with [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin) and [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani) to become Aes Sedai. She has the spark inborn; she will channel whether she wants to or not.

name: Breane Taborwin
info: A woman from Cairhien who is [Lamgwin](#Lamgwin-Dorn)'s love interest. She makes it clear that [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) is not her queen.

name: Brendas
info: Aes Sedai of the White Ajah. She never grilled [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) about [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)—she was also someone [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) trusted.

name: Bruan
info: Clan chief of the Nakai Aiel, of the Salt Flat sept. He is massive, with sad, gray eyes. He seems almost lazy by his voice and gray eyes, but even [Rhuarc](#Rhuarc) considers him to be a deadly fighter and a devious tactician.

name: Burdin
info: A man from Maerone who takes care of [Olver](#Olver). He gives him lots of food in exchange for caring for his horses. He refuses to let Olver ride them.

name: Burin Shaeren
info: [Lelaine](#Lelaine-Akashi)'s coppery-skinned Warder. He looks as though he was carved from an uprooted stump.

name: Cabriana Mecandes
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah who [Semirhage](#Semirhage) tortures (along with her Warder) in order to extract information from her about the Aes Sedai and the White Tower.

name: Caldin
info: Graying, leathery leader of _Hama N'dore_, the Mountain Dancers.

name: Calindin
info: One of the Accepted. She has black hair that she keeps in small braids. She is from Tarabon. She has been Accepted for around ten years.

name: Calle Coplin
info: A young woman from Emond's Field who has a crush on [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara). Perrin was not supposed to know that [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara) chased her with a stick for several blocks when she found out; she now works as a servant for the two of them.

name: Car'a'carn
info: _Car'a'carn_, p. 46 (51)—According to the Prophecy of Rhuidean, the man destined to unite the clans of the Aiel. The term means “Chief of Chiefs” in the Old Tongue.

name: Caraighan Maconar
info: Legendary Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She once brought a man about 2000 miles to Tar Valon to be gentled after he had killed her Two Warders. She is also credited with quelling the Comaidin Riots at a time when she _had_ no Warders. She is considered the archetypal Green sister.

name: Caraline Damodred
chapter: Chapter 17: The Wheel of a Life
info: Cairhienin noble vying for the Sun Throne in Cairhien; she is related to [Laman](#King-Laman-Damodred), the last king from House Damodred.

name: Carenna
info: Aes Sedai of unknown Ajah. She was very interested in the eavesdropping trick that [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) revealed; she had already discovered it for herself, but was trying to hide the fact.

name: Carilo
info: A Warder, on duty guarding [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) the night [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) saw her and went into a rage because they had captured her as well as him; he killed a Warder with his bare hands and mortally wounded another (he died in Healing) with the sword of the one who fell, all in the moments the sisters spent in shock before they could tie him up with the Power.

name: Carlinya
info: Aes Sedai of the White Ajah. She fled the White Tower when [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) was raised. She is one of the six sisters who controls much of the action in Salidar, despite not being part of the Hall of the Tower.

name: Cassin
info: Yellow-haired Aiel about an inch taller than [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). He is _Aethan Dor_, a Red Shield. He is of the Goshien Aiel.

name: Cavandra
info: Aes Sedai of unknown Ajah, former advisor to [Queen Tylin](#Queen-Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar) of Amador. She returned to the White Tower when [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) summoned the sisters back.

name: Cenn Buie
info: Knarled man from Emond's Field with a raspy voice. He is the local thatcher, and sits on the Village Council.

name: Ceran Tol
info: Artist who painted “Tempo of Infinity,” a painting [Sammael](#Sammael) procured for his apartments in Illian.

name: Ceri
info: Woman in [Lady Arilyn](#Lady-Arilyn-Dhulaine)'s manor who is going to have another baby.

name: Chaelin
info: Wise One of the Smoke Water sept of the Miagoma Aiel.

name: Charel
info: Groom in the White Tower's stables when [Theodrin](#Theodrin-Dabei) was fifteen. [Sheriam](#Sheriam-Bayanar) arranged for him to meet Theodrin in the first place in hopes she would like him; she had him sit in on her novice lessons so she could channel at all. Later, his twin sister [Marel](#Marel) was substituted without Theodrin's knowledge; after she was revealed, Theodrin could channel whenever she wanted.

name: Charl Gedwyn
info: One of the Asha'man. He tries to strike [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand) down as the Younglings flee the Aes Sedai camp, but [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) beats him away.

name: Chel Vanin
info: Fat man who [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) uses as a scout. He is a good rider, and Mat thinks he could steal a hen pheasant's eggs with her sitting on them (although he would likely steal her, too)—he also thinks Vanin could steal a horse out from under a nobleman and he would not know it for two days. He has a large space between his front teeth.

name: Chesa
info: [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s plumply pretty maid as the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat).

name: Chiad
info: A Maiden of the Spear of the Stones River sept of the Goshien Aiel. She is short for an Aiel woman, and has blonde hair. [Gaul](#Gaul) wants her to marry him, but she will not give up the spear. She is willing to be his lover, but marriage is out of the question (or so she says).

name: Chiape
info: One of [Graendal](#Graendal)'s “pets.” She was the Sh'boan of Shara, their equivalent to an Empress. She is newly widowed, meaning she took the duty of Sh'boan from her previous husband, the Sh'botay.

name: Chiarid
info: Merry-eyed Maiden of the Spear with blonde hair. She is old enough to be [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s mother.

name: Cilia Cole
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: Young woman from Emond's Field. She insisted on being tested for the ability to channel, but [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin) insisted she was too old to be a novice.

name: Cinchonine
info: Round innkeeper of The Crown of Roses, where the Salidar embassy stays while in Caemlyn.

name: Coiren Saeldain
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. She is plump and pompous, and leads the embassy [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) sent to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) in Cairhien.

name: Colinda
info: Wise One who [Sorilea](#Sorilea) sends to search the Royal Library of Cairhien. She is slender and has penetrating eyes.

name: Coramoor
info: According to the Sea Folk's Jendai Prophecy, the man who is destined to bring them out of their long wandering in the sea. He is the same man who is the fulfillment of just about every other prophecy known as well, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Corelna
info: Green-eyed “hawk of a woman” with gray hair. She is a Wise One.

name: Corianin Nedeal
info: Last Dreamer in the White Tower; an Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She died almost 400 years ago. Almost all of the _ter'angreal_ the Black Ajah stole from the Tower were last studied by her; they allow partial access to _Tel'aran'rhiod_, the World of Dreams.

name: Corman
chapter: Chapter 17: The Wheel of a Life
info: Gray-eyed Aiel of the Mosaada sept of the Goshien Aiel. He has scars across his nose. He is _Far Aldazar Din_, a Brother of the Eagle.

name: Cosain
info: Lean, yellow-haired Wise One of the Spine Ridge sept of the Miagoma Aiel.

name: Couladin
info: Self-appointed chief of the Shaido Aiel after the death of its last true chief, [Suladric](#Suladric). He never went to Rhuidean, but declared himself the _[Car'a'carn](#Car-a-carn)_ after [Asmodean](#Asmodean) placed two dragons on his arms in a copy of those on [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s arms. When the rest of the Aiel chiefs declared for Rand, Couladin took the Shaido west across the Spine of the World to ravage Cairhien. Although almost every other clan despises the Shaido, all agree that even they deserved a real chief—they never got one. Couladin died outside Cairhien while fighting [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)—Mat killed him, but later remarked that Couladin had to have been born with a spear in his hands to be that good.

name: Coura
info: An Ogier; she is [Amar](#Amar)'s mother and [Elora](#Elora)'s grandmother.

name: Covril
info: An Ogier from Stedding Shangtai, daughter of [Ella](#Ella) daughter of [Soong](#Soong). She is a fine Speaker. She comes to Caemlyn searching for her son [Loial](#Loial).

name: Cowinde
info: _Gai'shain_ assigned to [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) while she is studying with the Wise Ones. She has deep blue eyes. Her year and a day is up, but she refuses to put off the white.

name: Croi Makin
info: One of [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari)'s three Warders and husbands. He is young, skinny, and has blond hair.

name: Culain
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: Namesake of an inn in Caemlyn, Culain's Hound.

name: Daelvin
info: Round little woman with a gray bun, the innkeeper of The Golden Stag, the second-best inn in Maerone, located in the center of the city.

name: Daerid
info: Commander of the foot of the Band of the Red Hand. He is slightly taller than [Talmanes](#Lord-Talmanes-Delovinde), and about fifteen years older. His nose has been broken many times. He has been a soldier all his life, and was not nobly born.

name: Dagdara Finchey
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She is as wide as most men and taller than most. She fled the Tower when [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) was deposed.

name: Dagendra
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: A blocky Maiden of the Spear.

name: Dailin
info: A Maiden of the Spear, of the Nine Valleys sept of the Taardad Aiel. She died protecting [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Dain Bornhald
info: Son of [Geofram](#Geofram-Bornhald). He now commands his own troops; he also plans to avenge his father's death. He has a hatred of [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), since he thinks he had a hand in killing Geofram.

name: Daise Congar
info: Wisdom of Emond's Field after [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) left to accompany [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara). She is as tall as most men, and wider.

name: Dal
info: Father of [Haman](#Elder-Haman), son of [Morel](#Morel).

name: Dalar
info: An Ogier who stayed away from the _stedding_ for more than ten years. She needed a stick to walk again afterwards, but did continue to write.

name: Damer Flinn
info: Crease-faced old man with a limp who comes for [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s amnesty. He is bald with a fringe of white hair around the edge of his head. He was in the Queen's Guards until he took a Murandian lance in the thigh. He can channel.

name: Danelle
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah, the only Brown sister among [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan)'s group of followers and advisors that deposed [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche). She is young, but is nonetheless the typical Brown, often slight and seemingly lost in her own thoughts.

name: Dannil Lewin
info: A young man from Emond's Field, now one of [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s soldiers. A bean-pole of a man with a thick mustache.

name: Darea Candwin
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: Girl from Emond's Field. She comes with [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin) and [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani) to become Aes Sedai.

name: Daria Gahand
info: Author of _Essays on Reason_, a book [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) keeps in his bedchamber. He found it tough going, but [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) seems to like it.

name: Dark One
info: Name, used in every land, for [Shai'tan](#Dark-One).

name: Daughter of the Nine Moons
info: Woman whom [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) is destined to marry, according to the Aelfinn.

name: Dav Ayellin
info: A young man from Emond's Field. He is as old as [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), and left home to see the world after he heard Perrin's stories.

name: Davian
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) between the Trolloc Wars and the War of the Second Dragon. He could channel quite strongly.

name: Deane Aryman
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah, later raised to the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). She succeeded Bonwhin Meraighdin, Amyrlin during the reign of [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing). Her strong spirit and sturdy administration brought the Tower back to most of its former prestige, all of which was teetering on the brink of disappearing after Bonwhin's manipulations of Hawkwing. She in effect saved the Tower. She is one of the most respected Amyrlins of all time, and part of the reason a large number of Amyrlins have been raised from the Blue Ajah. She was born in the city of Salidar, in Eharon.

name: Dedric
info: A Red Shield of the Jaern Rift sept of the Codara Aiel.

name: Delana Mosalaine
info: A Sitter for the Gray Ajah in Salidar. She is round and has a deep, melodious voice. She is from Shienar.

name: Delin
info: Name that is being circulated in rumor for the next Queen of Andor. Of course, the name is supposed to be [Dyelin](#Dyelin-Taravin).

name: Demandred
info: One of the Forsaken. He has a hawk-like nose and dark hair. Second-best seems to be the story of his life. He was born [Barid Bel Medar](#Barid-Bel-Medar) one day after [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon), and from the first day proceeded to almost equal Lews Therin's accomplishments, almost equal Lews Therin's strength, and almost equal him but never surpass him in everything. He became one of the Light's greatest generals, once again second in command under Lews Therin. Demandred believed that he was Lews Therin's intellectual and military superior, and was furious when Lews Therin was chosen to lead the Light's forces over him during the War of the Shadow. He developed a burning hatred of Lews Therin, and finally dedicated his life to the Shadow so he could finally better Lews Therin—he believed the Shadow would eventually win the war since Lews Therin was commanding the Light's armies, and that if he, Barid Bel Medar, had been chosen to command them, the Light would have prevailed. When Demandred was freed from the Bore, he transferred his hatred of Lews Therin to the new recipient of his soul, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor). Demandred was recently told by the [Dark One](#Dark-One) to lead his plan to convert or destroy Rand, and promised him to be [Nae'blis](#Nae-blis) if he succeeded. Demandred's assumed identity and whereabouts are unknown.

name: Demira Eriff
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. Part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). She only spoke of two things: meeting Rand, and seeing the school he had started. In her eyes, no one who had started a school or a library or any other institution of knowledge could possibly be all bad. She grew up in Arad Doman.

name: Desaine
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel. She opposed [Sevanna](#Sevanna)'s appointment to Wise One, which Sevanna never forgave her for.

name: Desora
info: A Maiden of the Spear with golden hair. She has a habit of hiding a smile behind her hand. She is of the Musara sept of the Reyn Aiel.

name: Dhearic
info: Clan chief of the Reyn Aiel. He was formerly _Duadhe Mahdi'in_, a Water Seeker.

name: Dilham
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: Innkeeper of Culain's Hound, an inn in Caemlyn where [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin), [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani), and the girls from the Two Rivers stay while in Caemlyn.

name: Dimir Faral
info: Whitecloak who served as a scout for the assassination attempt on [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). Rand hanged his companions, but sent Faral back to Amador to tell [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall) that Rand would some day hang him for what he had done.

name: Doilan
info: _Gai'shain_ taken from the Shaido Aiel who serves the Wise Ones.

name: Dorindha
info: Wife of [Bael](#Bael). [Melaine](#Melaine) requested the other Wise Ones to ask her if she would accept Melaine as a sister-wife; she accepted, and Bael then had little choice but to marry Melaine as well. She has borne Bael three sons, but she and Melaine both know he would like a daughter.

name: Dragon Reborn
info: According to the _Karaethon Cycle_, the Prophecies of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon), the man who is the Rebirth of [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon), the man known as the [Dragon](#The-Dragon) during the War of the Shadow. Over the years, many men have claimed to be the Dragon Reborn, even men who could not channel. The true Dragon has been Reborn in a young man named [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), a shepherd from Emond's Field.

name: Dyelin Taravin
info: Next-in-line to the Lion Throne after [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand). She refuses to take the throne without absolute confirmation of the deaths of both of them, despite the feelings of some of Morgase's former supporters. She is Morgase's cousin.

name: Dylin
info: Name that is being circulated in rumor for the next Queen of Andor. Of course, the name is supposed to be [Dyelin](#Dyelin-Taravin).

name: Eben Hopwil
info: Skinny young man of about sixteen or so who comes for [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s amnesty. He has a big nose and ears to match.

name: Ebram
info: A tall, well-made man from Arad Doman. He would be in [Graendal](#Graendal)'s collection if he was more than a merchant's son.

name: Echiko
info: Accepted who jumped from the top of the Tower when [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari) was a novice, convinced she had learned how to fly.

name: Edarra
info: Wise One of the Nader sept of the Shiande Aiel. She has blue eyes, and is not much older than [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Edelle Gaelin
info: Woman from Watch Hill. She is thin and has gray hair. She thinks she should have [Daise Congar](#Daise-Congar)'s position as Wisdom of Emond's Field, not just be on its Women's Circle.

name: Edesina Azzedin
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She went to Tarabon to attempt to help restore order there.

name: Egwene al'Vere
info: A young woman from Emond's Field, now one of the Accepted. She has considerable potential with the One Power, and will most likely be one of the strongest Aes Sedai in over a thousand years. It is also thought that she may be the first Dreamer in the Tower in almost 500 years; she trained with the Wise Ones to learn more of this Talent. Egwene is good friends with [Elayne Trakand](#Elayne-Trakand), the Daughter-Heir of Andor, and is also a childhood friend of [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), the Dragon Reborn. In fact, Rand and Egwene were all but Promised in their youth, but both of them feels an almost sibling-like love for each other now; they know that they cannot get married, and do not want to. Egwene is the love object of both of Elayne's brothers, [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred) and [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand)—she is flattered by Galad's attentions, but she does not return them; she does find Gawyn to her liking.

name: Einor Saren
info: Inquisitor of the Hand of the Light. He summons [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) to [Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall).

name: Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan
info: Formerly Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah, now raised to the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) in Tar Valon. She served as advisor to [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) of Andor for her entire reign, and led the coup that deposed [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) and placed her on the Amyrlin Seat in her place. She distrusts anyone not of the Red Ajah (as most Reds do), and thinks she will never trust any member of the Blue Ajah again, even in the slightest. Her [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) is [Alviarin Freidhen](#Alviarin-Freidhen) of the White Ajah—she was all but forced to choose Alviarin due to her role in the deposition of Siuan. If she chose a Keeper from her Ajah, she most likely would not have won the support of the White Ajah, and then _she_ would have been stilled and banished from the Tower instead of Siuan. She sometimes has the Foretelling, but not all that often or that strongly. One of her Foretellings was that the Royal Family of Andor would play a crucial role in the Last Battle—this Foretelling occurred around the time the Succession was going on, so she immediately attached herself to Morgase as soon as it became clear that she would be the one to take the Lion Throne. Another was to predict that [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) would shake the world on its very foundations—she constantly kicks herself for not doing something about him when he was in front of her, little more than a farmboy at the time. The Foretelling about Rand is obviously deadly accurate, but the one about the Royal Family occurred at an inopportune time; at the time of Elaida's Foretelling, the Royal Family was not certain. It may have meant Morgase, [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand), [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred), and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) (they have all had a large role to play in the recent past), but it is also possible it could have meant the old Royal Family, that of [Tigraine](#Lady-Tigraine-Mantear), [Taringail](#Lord-Taringail-Damodred), Galad, and later Elayne and Gawyn as well. After all, Morgase is just Morgase, but Tigraine is the mother of the Dragon Reborn. Elaida is quite strong in the One Power; only Siuan, [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred), [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara), and a few others can match her strength.

name: Elam Dowtry
info: A young man from Emond's Field. He is as old as [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), and left home to see the world after he heard Perrin's stories.

name: Elayne Trakand
info: The Daughter-Heir of Andor, now one of the Accepted. She is the daughter of [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) and her late husband, [Taringail](#Lord-Taringail-Damodred), and sister to [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand). She is also half-sister to [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred), although she would rather not be reminded of this fact; she thinks Galad virtuous to the point of fault, and does not really like him. She has considerable potential in the One Power, and will most likely be the strongest Aes Sedai in a thousand years or more, possibly since the Age of Legends, with the exception of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara). She has red-gold curly hair. During her stay in the Stone of Tear, Elayne realized she loved [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), and told him how she felt; he felt similarly. She had no idea at the time what [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) meant about “having to share him,” but now knows about Min's viewing of Rand with the three women's heads, indicating that Rand will fall in love with Min, Elayne, and [Aviendha](#Aviendha), and they with him. Later, when she and Nynaeve had trouble with [Moghedien](#Moghedien), Elayne ended up bonding [Birgitte](#Birgitte) as her Warder (despite being only Accepted) in order to save Birgitte's life. Elayne is currently with the Aes Sedai in Salidar.

name: Elder Alar
info: An Elder of Stedding Tsofu. She is [Erith](#Erith)'s grandmother.

name: Elder Haman
info: One of the Elders of Stedding Shangtai, son of [Dal](#Dal) son of [Morel](#Morel). He comes with [Loial](#Loial)'s mother [Covril](#Covril) to find Loial and take him back to the _stedding_.

name: Eldrin Cauthon
info: [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s sister. She is sixteen. She and her sister [Bode](#Bodewhin-Bode-Cauthon) were always anxious to tell on Mat when he was up to mischief.

name: Elenia Sarand
info: Shrewish, honey-haired Andoran noble with an eye for [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). Her husband [Jarid](#Lord-Jarid-Sarand) opposed [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession.

name: Elise Marwin
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: Girl from Emond's Field. She comes with [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin) and [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani) to become Aes Sedai.

name: Ella
info: [Covril](#Covril)'s mother, [Soong](#Soong)'s daughter.

name: Elle
info: Fair-haired girl from Watch Hill. She comes with [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin) and [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani) to become Aes Sedai. She has the spark inborn; she will channel whether she is taught or not.

name: Elmindreda (Min) Farshaw
info: A young woman from Baerlon. She has a special ability that few besides herself know about: she sees images and auras around people, especially around Aes Sedai and Warders, that foretell their futures. Min does not always know what these viewings mean, but when she does, it _will_ happen; it is only a question of how and when. Min was fascinated by the number of images she saw around [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), especially the one she saw that included herself: he is destined to fall in love with three different women, one of which is herself. She usually dresses in attire reserved for men; this habit was picked up when growing up with her father, who was a miner. However, once she started to develop feelings for Rand, she began to wear more traditionally feminine attire. Min was in Tar Valon helping [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) with her viewings' information when Siuan was deposed, and it was Min that freed Siuan and [Leane](#Leane-Sharif) from the dungeon. She accompanied the two former leaders of the Aes Sedai to Salidar; once there, she left for Caemlyn with Salidar's embassy to Rand.

name: Elora
info: An Ogier, daughter of [Amar](#Amar) daughter of [Coura](#Coura). She wrote _Men of Fire and Women of Air_, a book about use of the One Power by humans, in the early days of [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing)'s reign.

name: Elsbet Luhhan
info: Misspelling of [Alsbet Luhhan](#Alsbet-Luhhan). _This mistake does not occur in later editions of the books._

name: Elwinn Taron
info: Wisdom of Deven Ride. She is short and round and has a motherly smile.

name: Emara
info: Small Accepted with gray eyes and a quick grin. She grew up in Illian. She dislikes [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) and [Leane](#Leane-Sharif).

name: Emerys
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel. Supports [Sevanna](#Sevanna).

name: Emry Lewin
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: Buxom girl from Emond's Field. She comes with [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin) and [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani) to become Aes Sedai.

name: Enaila
info: A Maiden of the Spear with red, fiery hair. She is short for an Aiel, a point of sensitivity for her. She is part of [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s honor guard.

name: Endara Casalain
info: Governor of Andor during [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing)'s time. She was [Ishara](#Queen-Ishara-Maravaile)'s mother, and the wife of [Joal Ramedar](#King-Joal-Ramedar), the last king of Aldeshar.

name: Erian Boroleos
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She has four Warders. Part of [Coiren](#Coiren-Saeldain)'s embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) in Cairhien.

name: Erim
info: Clan chief of the Chareen Aiel. He has red hair, half of which is white.

name: Erith
info: An Ogier from Stedding Tsofu, daughter of [Iva](#Iva) daughter of [Alar](#Elder-Alar). She wants to marry [Loial](#Loial), and although he likes her, he is avoiding her because he is convinced she will not want to live a nomadic life such as he needs to lead for the next few years in order to write his book.

name: Escaralde
info: Aes Sedai who insists on learning to make _ter'angreal_ despite not being strong enough. She fled the White Tower when [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) was deposed, and is now in Salidar.

name: Esmara Getares
info: Ruler after [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing)'s death. Her attempt to become High Queen about forty years before the end of the War of the Hundred Years ended when she invaded Andor and spent her last twelve years as a guest of [Queen Telaisien](#Queen-Telaisien). She was ultimately assassinated, although no one is sure why.

name: Espara Soman
info: Woman who came to Emond's Field with an interest in herbs.

name: Estair
info: [Aeron](#Aeron)'s red-haired apprentice.

name: Ewin Finngar
info: A young man from Emond's Field. He is as old as [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara), and left home to see the world after he heard [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s stories.

name: Faeldrin Harella
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She grew up in Tarabon. Part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). She has dark hair that she usually keeps in thin braids.

name: Faile ni Bashere t'Aybara
info: A young woman from Saldaea with long dark hair and dark eyes. She is the daughter of [Davram](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere) and [Deira](#Lady-Deira-ni-Ghaline-t-Bashere) Bashere, and their oldest surviving offspring. Her two older brothers were killed, and when Davram sent her younger brother off to fight while keeping her at home, she ran away and swore the oath of a Hunter of the Horn in Illian. When she became a Hunter, she renounced her old name, [Zarine](#Zarine-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara), at first considering adopting the name “Mandarb”—she chose Faile when she found Mandarb was the name of [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran)'s horse. She fell in love with [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) while on her search for the Horn, who told her that the Horn had been found. She was shocked, but even more so to find out that [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) was the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) and that both he and Perrin are _ta'veren_. Faile stayed near Perrin, and finally accompanied him to the Two Rivers where she helped fend off the Trolloc attacks; the two were married shortly afterwards. They were then proclaimed Lord and Lady of the Two Rivers. Perrin hated the idea, but Faile insisted they have a modest estate, and even servants, which she trained herself. Her name means “falcon” in the Old Tongue; she is the falcon in [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw)'s viewings of Perrin. She is very protective of her husband, and does whatever she can to make sure he not so much as _looks_ at another woman, even though he has no intention of doing so.

name: Faiselle
info: Sitter in the Hall of the Tower in Salidar who disapproves of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) being raised [Amyrlin](#Amyrlin-Seat).

name: Falion Bhoda
info: Aes Sedai of the White Ajah. She once fled to Ebou Dar as a runaway novice. She is now openly a member of the Black Ajah; she fled the Tower with [Liandrin](#Liandrin).

name: Faolain Orande
info: Dark, curly-haired Accepted. She has an extreme dislike for Wilders, and does not treat [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) and [Leane](#Leane-Sharif), who were stilled, very well either. She spent eight years as a novice, and five among the Accepted. She has since been raised to something more than Accepted, but still less than a full sister (due to the absence of the Oath Rod).

name: Farede
info: Panarch of Tarabon near the end of the War of the Hundred Years. She was responsible for promulgating the calendar that now bears her name, which measures years of the New Era (NE), the first of which marked the (arbitrary) end of the War.

name: Fedwin Morr
info: Husky young man who comes for [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s amnesty.

name: Frielle Anan
chapter: Chapter 51: The TakingChapter 52: Weaves of the Power
info: [Setalle](#Setalle-Anan)'s middle daughter. She has recently become engaged. She wants six boys of her own, and takes to helping keep track of [Olver](#Olver) for practice.

name: Furen Alharra
info: One of [Seonid](#Seonid-Traighan)'s Warders. She says he has taken wounds before that almost made her faint, but he has never slowed a step.

name: Gaidal Cain
info: Hero of Legend bound to the Horn of Valere. He is a swordsman, and is always linked to [Birgitte](#Birgitte) in the stories. Unlike his depiction in the stories (which say he is as handsome as Birgitte is beautiful), Gaidal Cain is one of the ugliest men that [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) has ever seen. Just being around him makes Nynaeve uncomfortable. Before being ripped out of _Tel'aran'rhiod_, Birgitte mentioned that she had not seen Gaidal around for some time, indicating that he has been spun out into the Pattern again. She fears she will never see him again.

name: Galadedrid (Galad) Damodred
info: Son of [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s late husband [Taringail Damodred](#Lord-Taringail-Damodred) and his first wife [Tigraine](#Lady-Tigraine-Mantear). He is half-brother to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand). Stunningly handsome, even [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) has trouble blushing when she speaks to him, and Aes Sedai will often forsook their work to watch him practice (shirtless) in the sword yard. Galad has much skill with the sword, and has acheived Blademaster status in practice if not in name. He disappeared from Tar Valon during the violence that accompanied [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche)'s deposition and joined [Eamon Valda](#Lord-Captain-Eamon-Valda)'s band of the Children of the Light. Because of his sword skill, Galad was promoted to an official position very quickly, and now controls his own small band of men. He says he became a Whitecloak because it “felt right.” He is extremely virtuous, and will do whatever he thinks is right regardless of who it hurts, even himself. His sign is a winged silver sword, point down. Galad has feelings for [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere), and although she is flattered by his attentions, she does not return his love.

name: Galina Casban
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. She has been head of the Red Ajah for eighteen years, although she is not a Sitter for the Red. She was the one who beat [Tarna Feir](#Tarna-Feir)'s block out of her; Galina knew she would choose Red before Tarna did. Galina has a begrudgingly positive opinion of [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan), who she believes is proving herself to be strong and capabable.

name: Gaul
info: An Aiel of the Imran sept of the Shaarad Aiel. He is _Shae'en M'taal_, a Stone Dog. [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) rescued him from his entrapment in Remen, and Gaul now walks at Perrin's side during battle and elsewhere. Gaul wants to marry [Chiad](#Chiad), but though she agrees to become his lover, she will not give up the spear for him.

name: Gawyn Trakand
info: Son of [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) of Andor and brother to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand). He will become First Prince of the Sword if Elayne becomes Queen. He and his half-brother [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred) went to train with the Warders in the White Tower, as all sons of Andoran queens have for centuries, and both now possess considerable skill with the sword. During the chaos that erupted after [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche)'s deposition, Gawyn formed a band of young men, everyone who had trained with the Warders except Galad, who are called the Younglings. The Younglings fought back against their teachers, who were trying to free Siuan and [Leane](#Leane-Sharif) from their imprisonment. Gawyn himself killed Hammar and Coulin, the men in charge of teaching the sword and for his personal training, respectively, both of which are Blademasters—few Warders are as good as they were, and Gawyn managed to kill both of them. Gawyn does not know which party to support—he believes that anyone who opposes Tower Law by trying to free Siuan and Leane is wrong, but at the same time he does not know all the facts surrounding the change in leadership. In fact, his sister Elayne and her friends [Nynaeve al'Meara](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) and [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere) side with those who broke from the Tower. This is especially difficult since Gawyn has feelings for Egwene, feelings which she returns. He believes the rumor that [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) killed his mother, and only refrains from killing him because Egwene made him promise not to. His sign is a white boar.

name: General Souran Maravaile
info: [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing)'s greatest general. He was the husband of [Ishara](#Queen-Ishara-Maravaile), the first Queen of Andor. He was one of the greatest swordsmen to ever live. He was the leader of the seige of Tar Valon for the final year of it.

name: Geofram Bornhald
info: [Dain](#Dain-Bornhald)'s father. He led the assault on Falme and the Seanchan there, at which he died. [Valda](#Lord-Captain-Eamon-Valda) did not appreciate him, and thinks he was “soft.”

name: Gera
info: One of the cooks in Salidar. She dreamed her way into _Tel'aran'rhiod_ for a brief moment while the six sisters and two Accepted were there; she was dreaming of being an Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah, much to the dismay of [Carlinya](#Carlinya).

name: Gitara Moroso
info: [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) from about twenty-six years ago until her death about twenty years ago. Before she was Keeper, she was counselor to [Queen Mordrellen](#Queen-Mordrellen-Mantear) of Andor, although she spent more time with her children. When she had the Foretelling, it was strong. One of her Foretellings was to tell [Tigraine](#Lady-Tigraine-Mantear) that she must become a Maiden of the Spear, or dire consequences would result; as it turned out, Tigraine needed to become [Shaiel](#Shaiel), the Maiden of the Spear who bore a son by [Janduin](#Janduin) that grew up to be [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). Another concerned Tigraine's brother [Luc](#Lord-Luc-Mantear); she told him his fame, or his fate, lay in the Blight; he went into the Blight, and was never seen again. Another extremely significant Foretelling occured at the moment of her own death: in front of the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) and two Accepted named [Moiraine Damodred](#Moiraine-Damodred) and [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), she felt the birth of the Dragon Reborn. She slumped over into Moiraine's arms, dead, after the words were out of her mouth.

name: Gorin Rogad
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) who was burned alive by the Illianers who caught him about four years ago.

name: Graendal
info: One of the Forsaken. A fleshy woman with curled red-gold hair. Before the War of the Shadow, she became the leading authority on diseases of the brain, and spent much of her life dealing with the insane, schizophrenic, and others well beyond the touch of Healing. She was the best at subtle manipulations of the human mind that ever lived. After the Bore was drilled, she went through a change after she realized the world could never live up to her standards. So she began dressing in the very way she once mocked, with low cut dresses that clung to her and left little to the imagination. After being released from the Bore, Graendal took up residence in Arad Doman, capturing several members of the Royal Family to use as servants. All of her servants are not only physically well shaped and good-looking, but also had power in their society before she captured them. She includes in her collection the sister of the Domani king, two rulers from Shara, and other important figures.

name: Guaire Amalasan
info: False [Dragon](#Dragon-Reborn) of centuries past, from Free Years 939–943. He started the War of the Second Dragon and conquered much of the world between the Aiel Waste and the Aryth Ocean before a young king named [Artur Paendrag Tanreall](#Artur-Hawkwing) rose to overwhelming prominence and power. Six Aes Sedai once attempted to capture him by themselves—he killed one of them and stilled two more. It took a full circle of thirteen to finally capture him, and during his trial his followers beseiged Tar Valon and tried to free him, getting as far as the White Tower itself before being turned back.

name: Guardsman-Lieutenant Martyn Tallanvor
info: Tall young man from Andor. He served in the Queen's Guards until [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) fled Andor. When [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril) had the guards swear new oaths to the laws and customs of Andor (instead of to the Queen), Tallanvor swore them but immediately went back to his room and reswore the old oath in the old style (cutting his arm with his sword, indicating that his blood will be shed before the Queen's will). He loves his queen more than his life, and now serves as her personal bodyguard.

name: Guisin
info: Aes Sedai who went to Tarabon to attempt to help restore order there.

name: Gwil
info: One of the servants [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara) trained for [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara). Perrin treats him as a friend and drinking partner, not a servant.

name: Hachari
info: A man who tried to kill [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim) while he still called himself the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). Taim let him live, and sent him back to [Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere).

name: Hal Moir
info: One of the Younglings. He is two years older than [Jisao](#Jisao-Hamora).

name: Hal
info: One of the servants [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara) trained for [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara). Perrin treats him as a friend and drinking partner, not a servant.

name: Half Tail
info: One of the wolves. He is an old, sour male.

name: Halima Saranov
info: Slender, lush woman with green eyes that comes to Salidar to become [Delana](#Delana-Mosalaine)'s maid. She is actually [Aran'gar](#Aran-gar). [Anaiya](#Anaiya) was the first Aes Sedai to meet her in Salidar, and she sent [Lucilde](#Lucilde) to escort her to Delana.

name: Halwin Norry
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: Chief clerk in the Royal Palace in Caemlyn. He has wisps of gray hair that stand up like quill pens.

name: Hamad
info: One of [Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere)'s men. He goes to fetch the emmissary from [Lord Brend](#Lord-Brend) to see [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Han
info: White-haired, leathery-faced clan chief of the Tomanelle Aiel. He is considered quite short for an Aiel, which is average to tall for most people. His personality is prickly at best.

name: Haral Luhhan
info: Blacksmith of Emond's Field. [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) was his apprentice before he left home. He is a very large man, which works well for work at the forge. His wife, [Alsbet](#Alsbet-Luhhan), is almost as large as he is, and nearly as strong. He approves of the new arrivals in Emond's Field, and has even ventured into business partnerships with some of the newcomers.

name: Harilin
info: Lanky, red-haired Maiden of the Spear. She is about the same age as [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Harine din Togara Two Winds
info: Wavemistress of the Sea Folk ship that comes to meet [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) in Cairhien. Her ship is the _White Spray_. [Berelain](#Berelain-sur-Paendrag-Paeron) reports that she has a temper. She is of Clan Shodein.

name: Harnan
info: Lantern-jawed Redarm, a file-leader in the Band of the Red Hand. He has a long-suffering expression and a crude hawk tattoo on his left cheek.

name: Havien Nurelle
chapter: Chapter 17: The Wheel of a Life
info: Lord Lieutenant of [Berelain](#Berelain-sur-Paendrag-Paeron)'s Winged Guards. Pink cheeked and young.

name: He Who Comes With the Dawn
info: According to the Aiel's Prophecy of Rhuidean, the man who will unite the clans of the Aiel and bring them out of the Three-Fold Land. With him, a “remnant of a remnant” will survive the Last Battle; without him, every Aiel alive will die. He Who Comes With the Dawn is said to come at dawn from Rhuidean, marked with two Dragons instead of one. Some call He Who Comes With the Dawn the _[Car'a'carn](#Car-a-carn)_, the Chief of Chiefs—both are the same man, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor). Rand fulfills the requirements of being the son of a Maiden of the Spear, raised by “wetlanders” and of Aiel blood.

name: Henre Haslin
info: Former Master of the Sword for the Queen's Guards in Caemlyn. He was too old for campaigning, so [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril) handed him his pension and showed him the gate to get him out of the way. When news of [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s death, he started drinking. He believes that Gaebril killed her, and is willing to teach [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s students.

name: Herid Fel
info: Stout Andoran who ended up in the Royal Library in Cairhien. He studies history and philosophy.

name: High King Artur Paendrag Tanreall
info: Hero of Legend who conquered much of the known world about a thousand years ago. He was called [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing) during his reign. He was perhaps the most strongly _ta'veren_ man besides [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) and [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor). His armies put down those of [Guaire Amalasan](#Guaire-Amalasan), a false [Dragon](#Dragon-Reborn), and he even sent troops across the Aryth Ocean under his son, Luthair Paendrag Mondwhin, in hopes of conquering new lands there. All contact with these armies ended with Hawkwing's death, which set off the War of the Hundred Years. The descendants of the armies under Luthair have now returned to reclaim the lands of Hawkwing's empire in the Old World—they now call themselves the Seanchan. His sign was a golden hawk in flight.

name: High Lady Anaiyella Narencelona
info: Willowy High Lady of Tear.

name: High Lady Estanda
info: High Lady of Tear, one of those who went into hiding in Haddon Mirk once the battle at Cairhien was over.

name: High Lord Gueyam
info: Bald High Lord of Tear.

name: High Lord Aracome
info: A gray, slender High Lord of Tear with a long-smoldering temper.

name: High Lord Darlin Sisnera
info: High Lord of Tear, one of those who went into hiding in Haddon Mirk once the battle at Cairhien was over. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) says he almost admires him—he opposed Rand from the very start, fleeing the Stone of Tear when it fell and trying to rouse resistance among the rural nobles.

name: High Lord Hearne
info: A Leader of Tairen military forces in Cairhien. He is one of the High Lords of Tear. When the battle in Cairhien was over, he and a few other High Lords took to hiding in Haddon Mirk—they are traitors to the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn).

name: High Lord Maraconn
info: High Lord of Tear with blue eyes (rare for a Tairen).

name: High Lord Meilan Mendiana
info: A High Lord of Tear, one of those with claims to the Sun Throne. He has a pointed beard and an oily voice.

name: High Lord Reimon
info: Commander of the Eagles, a subdivision of the Band of the Red Hand. He was a High Lord of Tear.

name: High Lord Simaan
info: A Leader of Tairen military forces in Cairhien. He is one of the High Lords of Tear. When the battle in Cairhien was over, he and a few other High Lords took to hiding in Haddon Mirk—they are traitors to the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn).

name: High Lord Sunamon Haellin
info: Unctuous, overly plump High Lord of Tear. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) once made him responsible for a treaty between Tear and Mayene, one that is fair to both nations and respects Mayene's sovreignty.

name: High Lord Tedosian
info: High Lord of Tear, one of those who went into hiding in Haddon Mirk once the battle at Cairhien was over. He is married to Alteima, but their marriage is not a happy one.

name: High Lord Tolmeran
info: High Lord of Tear with an iron-gray beard trimmed like a spear point. He is quite lean.

name: High Lord Torean Andiama
info: Potato-nosed High Lord of Tear. He looks more like a farmer than most farmers, despite being the richest man in Tear. He was charged with financing the Cairhienin campaign. His son [Estean](#Lord-Estean-Andiama) was also involved in the battle.

name: High Lord Weiramon Saniago
info: A High Lord of Tear. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) placed him in charge of his campaigns in Cairhien at first. His sign is a silver Crescent-and-stars.

name: Hilde Barran
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: Plump girl from Emond's Field. She comes with [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin) and [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani) to become Aes Sedai.

name: Hu
info: An “irascible old farmer.” He is the subject of a joke [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) tells the Maidens in an attempt to prove that in fact they are the ones who lack a sense of humor, not him.

name: Ibrella
info: Novice in Salidar. During [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s class, she decided to see how big a flame she could make and almost set the entire class on fire.

name: Idrien Tarsin
info: Head of [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s school in Cairhien.

name: Ihvon
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: One of [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani)'s Warders.

name: Ilyena Therin Moerelle
info: Wife of [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) during the Age of Legends and the War of the Shadow. She has light hair similar in color to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Aviendha](#Aviendha). According to the memories of Lews Therin's that flash through [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s head, Ilyena never flashed her temper at Lews Therin when she got angry at herself.

name: Indirian
info: Clan chief of the Codarra Aiel. Tall and massive with a hard, sober face.

name: Ishamael
info: One of the Forsaken. He was the most powerful of the Forsaken, and during the Age of Legends he was a prominent philosopher and theologian named Elan Morin Tedronai. He was never really bound inside the Bore, and led the hidden forces of the Shadow for the three thousand odd years from the end of the War of the Shadow to the present. He took credit for such things as convincing the then insane [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) to kill everyone he loved, pursuading the dying [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing) not to accept the Aes Sedai Healing that might have saved his life, sending the Trollocs out of the Great Blight during the Trolloc Wars, and many other events in history that turned out poorly. When the rest of the Forsaken were freed, Ishamael kept them away from each other's throats. He confronted [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) at the Eye of the World where he was severed from the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s bonds; he confronted him again at Falme where Rand melted his sword when he put it through him, but not after Ishamael gave Rand a wound that he has not been able to recover from yet; and he confronted Rand in the Stone of Tear after he took _Callandor_. Rand killed Ishamael after beating him sore by plunging _Callandor_ into his heart. His body rotted quickly, but it was proof that [Ba'alzamon](#Ba-alzamon), which he called himself to the public, was a human being, and not the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Iva
info: [Erith](#Erith)'s mother, [Alar](#Elder-Alar)'s daughter.

name: Jaem
info: [Vandene](#Vandene-Namelle)'s old, stringy Warder. When he is not practicing with his sword, he is sharpening it.

name: Jahar Narishma
info: A young man not much past twenty with the spark of _saidin_ inborn. He has dark eyes as big as a girl's, pale skin, and hair in long braids.

name: Jaichim Carridin
info: An Inquisitor for the Hand of the Light, better known as the Questioners; he aspires to some day become High Inquisitor, perhaps even Lord Captain Commander. Surprisingly enough for a Whitecloak, much less a Questioner, Carridin is a Darkfriend. He was given orders (under the name Bors) by [Ishamael](#Ishamael) to find and kill [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), and those orders were strengthened by a Myrddraal who promised to kill another member of Carridin's family every month until al'Thor was dead. So far, Carridin has lost a cousin (found skinned alive in his bed) and his youngest sister Dealda (carried from her bridal feast by a Fade). He expects his sister, Vanora, to be next.

name: Jain Farstrider
info: Hero of legend. There is a book about him, _The Travels of Jain Farstrider_, that [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) intends to read but never has. The book is quite popular with his friends, including [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), and [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Jak o' the Mists
info: I think it's just something fun to say. Usually used in something like “quicker than you can say ‘Jak o' the Mists.’ ”

name: Jak o' the Shadows
info: A term used in war chants and battle songs of old to symbolize death. The usual use is to dance with Jak o' the Shadows, meaning dance with death.

name: Jak o' the Wisps
info: I think it's just something fun to say. Usually used in something like, “Quicker than you can say ‘Jak o' the Mists.’ ”

name: Jalani
info: A Maiden of the Spear, part of [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s honor guard. She is the youngest among them, only sixteen.

name: Jan
info: One of [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw)'s aunts.

name: Jancy Torfinn
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: High-voiced girl from Emond's Field. She comes with [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin) and [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani) to become Aes Sedai. She is about fourteen years old, the youngest of the girls who came with Verin and Alanna. She has the spark inborn; she will channel whether she is taught or not.

name: Janduin
info: [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s biological father, an Aiel of the Iron Mountain sept of the Taardad Aiel. He was the youngest clan chief of the Taardad Aiel in memory. He ended the blood feud between the Taardad and Nakai clans after over 200 years of fighting, and then allied not only with the Nakai, but with the Reyn Aiel as well (who were not much better than blood enemies before the alliance was made). He almost ended the blood feud between the Shaarad and Goshien clans (which still existed until only a short time ago, causing trouble for [Chiad](#Chiad) and [Gaul](#Gaul)), and would have if [King Laman](#King-Laman-Damodred) would not have cut down _Avendoraldera_. He loved [Shaiel](#Shaiel), to the point where he could not refuse to let her fight in the Aiel War despite being with child. It was Janduin himself who led the four clans; Taardad, Nakai, Reyn, and Shaarad; across the Spine of the World to punish Laman for his Sin, throwing the entire World into war and allowing Prophecy to be fulfilled.

name: Janya Frende
info: A Sitter for the Brown Ajah. She is extraordinarily neat, especially for a Brown—every one of her short, dark hairs is exactly in place at all times. She is very old, though her hair is not yet gray.

name: Jaril
info: Alleged son of [Marigan](#Marigan). Along with [Seve](#Seve), he was taken off the street by Marigan and treated as her son to take some suspicion away from her in case anyone suspected her true identity. When Marigan's true identity was found out, Jaril and Seve were taken in by other women in Salidar.

name: Javindhra Doraille
info: Leader of six Red sisters who found [Logain](#Logain-Ablar) in Cosamelle about a year before he proclaimed himself. Logain claims she and her group persuaded him to become a false Dragon.

name: Jeade'en
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s stallion. He named the horse after [Jain Farstrider](#Jain-Farstrider)'s horse.

name: Jearom
info: The greatest Blademaster of all time. He fought over 10,000 times in battle and in single combat. He once defeated ten men all by himself. He was only defeated once—by a farmer with a quarterstaff.

name: Jen
info: A merchant from Four Kings, and [Paitr](#Paitr-Conel)'s uncle.

name: Jeorad Manyard
info: Governor of the province of Andor during the reign of the High King [Artur Paendrag Tanreall](#Artur-Hawkwing). He produced a translation of _The Prophecies of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon)_.

name: Jerilin al'Caar
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: Skinny girl from Emond's Field. She comes with [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin) and [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani) to become Aes Sedai.

name: Jesse Bilal
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah, and head of the Browns' council.

name: Jheran
info: Clan chief of the Shaarad Aiel. He was formerly _Sovin Nai_, a Knife Hand. He and [Bael](#Bael) finally ended the centuries of blood feud between the Shaarad and Goshien Aiel, which [Janduin](#Janduin) attempted to stop and [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) finally did.

name: Jidar
info: One of [Vilnar](#Vilnar-Barada)'s men. He claims Aes Sedai are so beautiful they can kill a man by smiling.

name: Jisao Hamora
info: Youngest of [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand)'s Younglings. He wears a silver Tower on his collar, the mark of a veteran fighter who saw the riots in the White Tower along with Gawyn.

name: Joana
info: Name by which [Birgitte](#Birgitte) was known by in past lives.

name: Joline Maza
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She was one of two Aes Sedai sent as ambassadors to [Queen Tylin](#Queen-Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar) in Ebou Dar.

name: Jon Ayellin
info: A large, bald man from the Two Rivers. He and [Thad Torfinn](#Thad-Torfinn) dispute the boundaries of their farms.

name: Jonan Adley
info: One of the men who came for [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s amnesty; he is now learning under [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim)'s tutilage.

name: Jori
info: Bald, square-faced Warder no taller than [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) and wide as any man. Bonded to [Morvrin](#Morvrin).

name: Juilin Sandar
info: Thief-taker from Tear, one of the best at his craft. He accompanied [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) on their travels because [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran) asked him to. He accepted partly out of respect for Lan, and partly out of guilt; he betrayed Elayne, [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), and Nynaeve to the Black Ajah when [Liandrin](#Liandrin) used Compulsion on him, and later realized how wrong it was. He carries a notched sword-breaker and a staff with which he is deadly.

name: Jur Grady
info: Stocky, dark-eyed man, about seven years older than [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). He comes for the Amnesty.

name: Juric
info: One of [Bair](#Bair)'s _gai'shain_. He refuses to put off the white despite being beaten until Bair's arm is sore.

name: Kairen Stang
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. She grew up in Andor. Part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Kari al'Thor
info: [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s mother.
