Kari was not actually his biological mother; Rand's real mother was a Maiden of the Spear who bore him on Dragonmount where he was found by Kari's husband, [Tam](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor). Kari met Tam while he was stationed in Caemlyn during his military duties, and the two got married. They returned to Tam's home, Emond's Field, with the child he found on the mountain at the end of the Aiel War, which they named Rand. Kari died when Rand was about five years old; she was the only mother Rand ever knew, and all he remembers of her was her soft touch.

name: Katerine Alruddin
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. She is part of [Coiren](#Coiren-Saeldain)'s embassy from Tar Valon.

name: Kaylin
info: One of the servants in Salidar.

name: Keatlin
info: Woman in [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s novice class. She keeps muttering about how she had never let a _girl_ order her around back home.

name: Keeper of the Chronicles
info: Essentially the secretary to the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). The Keeper is traditionally chosen from the same Ajah the Amyrlin was raised from, and wears a stole of the color of her Ajah instead of the striped stole of the Amyrlin. The post was held by [Leane Sharif](#Leane-Sharif) of the Blue Ajah until a coup deposed [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) and stilled both Siuan and Leane. Her successor was [Alviarin Freidhen](#Alviarin-Freidhen) of the White Ajah, despite the fact that Siuan's successor was from the Red.

name: Kely Huldin
info: A weaver of about age thirty who comes to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) for the Amnesty.

name: Kin Tovere
info: Stocky lens maker from Cairhien; he now works at [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s school. He is now into telescopes.

name: King Ailron
info: Annointed by the Light, King and Defender of Amadicia, Guardian of the Southern Gate. He is balding, and has dark, wavy hair. His nose is too long, and his ears are to big. He has little real power as king; the true power in Amadicia is [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall) and the Children of the Light.

name: King Alsalam Saeed Almadar
info: The King of Arad Doman. He was not up to [Graendal](#Graendal)'s standards, so she did not capture him as one of her “pets.”

name: King Galldrian su Riatin Rie
info: Late King of Cairhien. He assumed the throne after House Damodred lost the throne in the Aiel War because of [Laman](#King-Laman-Damodred)'s Sin. His death precipitated the civil war in Cairhien; all of the nobles fought with each other over Galldrian's kingdom, and ended up destroying it in the process.

name: King Joal Ramedar
info: The last King of Aldeshar before [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing) made it a province. He married [Endara Casalain](#Endara-Casalain), the governor of Andor. Their daughter, [Ishara](#Queen-Ishara-Maravaile), later became the first queen of Andor.

name: King Laman Damodred
info: King of Cairhien about twenty years ago. His cutting of _[Avendoraldera](#Avendoraldera)_ to make a throne unlike anything the world had ever seen precipitated the Aiel War. The war continued for years until all nations united against the Aiel and even Tar Valon was threatened; the war finally ended when the Aiel killed Laman and took his sword. Because of Laman's Pride, and his Sin, House Damodred lost the throne of Cairhien to House Riatin, and the city never again reached any of its former glory. However, it also allowed Prophecy to be fulfilled: the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) was able to be born on the slopes of Dragonmount, born of a Maiden of the Spear but raised by the blood of the old nations.

name: King Mattin Stepaneos den Balgar
info: King of Illian. Since [Sammael](#Sammael) sits on the Council of Nine, which holds most of the power in Illian, he is essentially a figurehead position at this point. He wears Illian's Laurel Crown, and rules in name if not in truth.

name: King Roedran Almaric do Arreloa a'Naloy
info: King of Murandy, at least in name. In reality, Murandians hold allegiance to lords only, and those lords often refuse to pay their taxes to the King.

name: Kinslayer
info: Name given to [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) after he killed his family in his madness.

name: Kiruna Nachiman
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She is an elegant, statuesque woman, and is a sister to the King of Arafel. She has four Warders. She was sent, along with [Bera](#Bera-Harkin), to establish diplomatic relations with [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) in the Aiel Waste.

name: Koimal
info: [Shandin](#Shandin)'s father, [Ledar](#Ledar)'s grandfather.

name: Kolom
info: An Ogier, son of [Radlin](#Radlin) and father of [Serden](#Serden).

name: Kwamesa
chapter: Chapter 35: In the Hall of the Sitters
info: Youngest Sitter in the Hall of the Tower in Salidar; an Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. Dark and slender.

name: Ladwin
info: One of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s scouts for the Band of the Red Hand. He did not return to the Band; [Vanin](#Chel-Vanin) suspects he was taken by a Warder near Salidar.

name: Lady Aemlyn Carand
info: Andoran lady, leader of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled her from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion.

name: Lady Altalin
info: A noblewoman of Amadicia who served as a lady-in-waiting to Morgase under the command of Pedron Niall. She has a plump face and made a bad pun about Galad.

name: Lady Arathelle Renshar
info: Andoran noble, wife of a leader of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled her from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion, but hopes she will still support her when she comes to claim the throne.

name: Lady Arilyn Dhulaine
info: One of [Coiren](#Coiren-Saeldain)'s spies. She is around the middle of Cairhien's nobility.

name: Lady Basene
info: A minor noble in Arad Doman, of a new House. She is actually [Graendal](#Graendal), who moved to an abandoned manor house in rural Arad Doman as her base of operations.

name: Lady Carlys Ankerin
info: Gray, curly-haired, devious Andoran noble.

name: Lady Colavaere Saighan
info: Cairhienin lady. She is handsome and in her middle years. She has dark, curly hair. She is making claim to the Sun Throne.

name: Lady Daerilla Raened
info: Plump, giggly Andoran noble.

name: Lady Deira ni Ghaline t'Bashere
info: [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere)'s wife, and [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s mother. She is about a head taller than her husband, and is big for a woman. She has black hair.

name: Lady Ellorien Traemane
info: Andoran lady, leader of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession, and one of Morgase's best friends. Morgase exiled her from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion; when Ellorien demanded to know why, Morgase had her flogged. [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) was named after her grandmother. Morgase hopes she will forgive her for what she did and support her when she comes to Andor to reclaim her throne.

name: Lady Fionnda Annariz
info: Lady of Cairhien.

name: Lady Karind Anshar
info: Andoran noblewoman. Her stare allegedly put three husbands under the soil. She was banished from the Palace grounds except for state occasions for opposing [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Third War of Andoran Succession during which Morgase came to power. When [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) killed [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril), she came to him and tried to win his favor—she only wants to advance her own power and influence in Andor.

name: Lady Marande Algoran
info: Pretty Altaran noblewoman with a heart-shaped face. Sister of the High Seat of House Algoran. She is powerful enough to resist [Ailron](#King-Ailron), but not [Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall).

name: Lady Naean Arawn
info: A slim, palely beautiful Andoran noble with big, blue eyes and waves of black hair. She sneers a lot. She opposed [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession.

name: Lady Tigraine Mantear
info: First wife of [Taringail Damodred](#Lord-Taringail-Damodred), and [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred)'s mother. She was the Daughter-Heir to the Throne of Andor and daughter of [Queen Mordrellen](#Queen-Mordrellen-Mantear), but she disappeared. Her disappearance set of the Third War of Andoran Succession. When [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) was in the Royal Palace in Caemlyn, several people commented on his striking resemblance to Tigraine; this is no coincidence, since Tigraine is Rand's mother. She fled to the Aiel Waste upon a warning from [Gitara Moroso](#Gitara-Moroso) to become a Maiden of the Spear, and gave birth to Rand when the Aiel were fighting near Tar Valon.

name: Lamelle
info: A Maiden of the Spear, of the Smoke Water sept of the Miagoma Aiel. She died protecting [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Lamgwin Dorn
info: A hard, bulky man from Caemlyn. He lived as a street thug, but was loyal to his queen. He joined [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) when she left the country.

name: Lanfear
info: One of the Forsaken. Unlike the rest of the Forsaken, she chose her name for herself, which means “Daughter of the Night” in the Old Tongue. She was born Mierin Eronaile, and was strong in the One Power. She worked at the Collam Daan, the primary facility for research into the One Power. Her final discovery there was what she thought was a new source for the One Power, one that could be harnessed by men and women alike—this source turned out to be the emissions through a thin spot in the Pattern from the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s prison. She and another Aes Sedai named Beidomon bored into that prison, creating what is now referred to as simply the Bore, allowing the Dark One to touch the world again and leading to the War of the Shadow. Around this time, Mierin had a relationship with [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon), who headed the forces of the Light against the Shadow and was the most powerful and influential man she had found. Lews Therin broke off the relationship when he found that she only wanted him for his power and authority and the possibility of power for herself through him. Mierin never let go of him, and when he later met and married [Ilyena Moerelle](#Ilyena-Therin-Moerelle) she tried to disrupt the wedding ceremony as well as split the two apart by any means. Eventually she went to Shayol Ghul to dedicate her soul to the Shadow, most likely to get back at Lews Therin for leaving her. She declared as her territory the World of Dreams, _Tel'aran'rhiod_, using it to ends now unknown. She transferred her obsessive love intact to Lews Therin's soul's new body, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), after being freed from the Bore. She first appeared to him as a young woman named Selene, disguising her appearance as a slightly less beautiful (but still stunning) woman. Almost a year later, Lanfear found that Rand had been “unfaithful” to her, and she tried to kill him. Before she could, she was pushed through the twisted stone doorway _ter'angreal_ by [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred).

name: Lanita
info: A novice in the White Tower. [Anaiya](#Anaiya) sent her to bed after the bubble of evil passed.

name: Larine Ayellin
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: Willowy girl from Emond's Field. She comes with [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin) and [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani) to become Aes Sedai. She is about three years younger than [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Larissa Lyndel
info: Bony Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. In Salidar.

name: Laritha
info: Woman [Thom Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) tried to rescue from an abusive marriage. She kicked him so hard when he actually offered to take her away (as she told him she wanted) that he limped for a month; then she hit him with a bench.

name: Laurain
info: Slender woman with dark eyes and a permanent simper. She is one of [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s servants in Amadicia.

name: Lawdrin Mendair
info: One of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s men. He brought a lot of brandy with him, which [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) discovered and made him pour out.

name: Leane Sharif
info: A woman from Arad Doman with coppery skin. Just as her family members were training her in the seductive ways of Domani women, Leane found that her life would take a different direction; she could channel _saidar_, and would do so with or without teaching. She became an Aes Sedai, a member of the Blue Ajah, and was eventually raised to [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) under [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche). During the coup led by [Elaida a'Roihan](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) and [Alviarin Freidhen](#Alviarin-Freidhen) that deposed Siuan, Leane was thrown in the dungeon and stilled. Leane has turned to her seductive side to try to replace what she lost in stilling; she is out of practice, but does well enough. She eventually convinced the Aes Sedai in Salidar to let her stay with them and maintain the network of eyes-and-ears she kept in Tar Valon as Keeper.

name: Ledar
info: An Ogier, son of [Shandin](#Shandin) son of [Koimal](#Koimal). He wrote _A Study of Men, Women, and the One Power Among Humans_ about three hundred years ago.

name: Leiran
info: A Thunder Walker of the Cosaida sept of the Chareen Aiel. He has blond hair and blue eyes.

name: Lelaine Akashi
info: Slender Sitter for the Blue Ajah in Salidar. She carries a dignified air about her.

name: Lerian
info: Lean, sandy-haired Maiden of the Spear, of an age with [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara).

name: Lews Therin Telamon
info: The [Dragon](#The-Dragon), Breaker of the World. He was perhaps the greatest man who ever lived, and the most powerful Aes Sedai in recorded history. During the War of the Shadow, he led the forces of the Light against the Forsaken, and led the final stroke which re-sealed the [Dark One](#Dark-One) back into his prison. Unfortunately, during this stroke he was driven insane by the Dark One's touch, eventually killing his wife [Ilyena](#Ilyena-Therin-Moerelle), his children, and everyone he loved, as well as anyone who carried a drop of his blood. For this act, people remember him with a new name: [Kinslayer](#Kinslayer). After he had done this, [Ishamael](#Ishamael) gave him his sanity back long enough for him to realize what he had done; Lews Therin killed himself by drawing on _saidin_ too heavily, causing a mountain to form on the spot where he stood. This mountain is called Dragonmount, and is near the present-day city of Tar Valon. It is unfortunate that the name of one of the greatest men to ever live is now synonymous with evil, for Lews Therin killed his family due to the Dark One's influence, but without Lews Therin there may not have been a world left in which to kill them. Lews Therin's voice sometimes speaks inside [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s head, offering advice or sobbing over lost women, but is getting more and more vocal. It even tries to seize control of _saidin_ sometimes, much to Rand's fear.

name: Liah
info: A Maiden of the Spear with a scar across her face. She is of the Cosaida sept of the Chareen Aiel.

name: Liale Mosrana
info: Woman from Tarabon who fled to the Two Rivers.

name: Lian
info: Mother-sister to [Aviendha](#Aviendha), sister-wife to [Amys](#Amys), wife of [Rhuarc](#Rhuarc). She is the roofmistress of Cold Rocks Hold.

name: Liandrin
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, formerly of the Red. She has light hair and a face like a doll. She grew up in Tarabon. She led the group of thirteen Aes Sedai who declared themselves Black Ajah and fled the White Tower, murdering guards and even sisters in the process. Liandrin was Red Ajah before turning to the Black, but her oath to the Black was sworn before even being raised to the Accepted (perhaps before she came to the Tower), so it cannot really be said that she was ever Red Ajah at all. It was Liandrin who effectively sold [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) into slavery to the Seanchan as a _damane_; she attempted to do the same to [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand). Egwene still has nightmares about her. Liandrin always seeks to gain power for herself through whatever means she can; this has recently gotten her on the bad side of [Moghedien](#Moghedien), and may bring about the very downfall in the ranks of the Shadow which she was trying to prevent.

name: Lini Eltring
info: Childhood nurse to Maighdin, [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand), and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) Trakand. She has many wise sayings, which Elayne and Morgase are fond of quoting to themselves and others (probably because they have been ingrained into their minds so much). She went with Morgase when she fled Andor to Amadicia.

name: Logain Ablar
info: A false [Dragon](#Dragon-Reborn) who created war in Ghealdan and surrounding nations before being captured and gentled by the Red Ajah. He got loose during the chaos surrounding the deposing of [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), and eventually was escorted out of Tar Valon by Siuan and her traveling companions. Before he was gentled he was of considerable strength, and attracted quite a following of loyal soldiers. [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) still has viewings of him with a halo over his head, which she thinks indicates that he will become a figure of great power sometime in the future. Recently, Logain has come forward with information that indicates the Red Ajah actually put him up to declaring himself the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), most likely with the pretext that bringing down a false Dragon would be less likely to be negatively critiqued than gentling a simple man who could channel.

name: Loial
info: Son of Arent son of Halan, an Ogier from Stedding Shangtai. He left the _stedding_ at around age 90 to see the world; by Ogier standards, he is not yet old enough to leave the _stedding_ without permission from the Council of Elders. He is fond of books and history, and is an excellent Treesinger. He is writing a book about his travels with the three _ta'veren_ he meets, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara). Loial is constantly afraid that his mother will find him and try to marry him off and settle him down. He, like most of the Ogier, is sad that most humans do not remember the Ogier, and is horrified that some even think he is a Trolloc on first seeing him.

name: Lopin
info: A stout man who serves [Nalesean](#Lord-Nalesean-Aldiaya).

name: Lord Abelle Pendar
info: Andoran noble, leader of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled him from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion, but hopes he will still support her when she comes to claim the throne.

name: Lord Agelmar Jagad
info: Lord of Fal Dara, and commander of the King's army in Shienar. He is one of the best military commanders in the World, in such company as [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne), [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall), [Rodel Ituralde](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde), [Matrim Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and a few Aiel chiefs. Bashere asked Mat if he had learned some of his military knowledge from Agelmar while he was in Shienar; Bashere had no way of knowing about Mat's memories from his past lives as military commanders in Manetheren.

name: Lord Alhandrin
info: A lord who commands part of the Band of the Red Hand.

name: Lord Barel Layden
info: Andoran noble, leader of a minor House.

name: Lord Barthanes Damodred
info: High Seat of House Damodred, the most powerful house in Cairhien besides House Riatin, the former king's house. He was a Darkfriend, and died the last time [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) was in Cairhien. His estate is now used as Rand's library. His sign is a charging boar.

name: Lord Brend
info: Name [Sammael](#Sammael) uses as a member of the Council of Nine in Illian. He rules Illian in truth, if not in name.

name: Lord Captain Commander Pedron Niall
info: Lord Captain Commander of the Children of the Light, highest office among the Children. He is one of the great military commanders in the world, in company with [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), [Agelmar Jagad](#Lord-Agelmar-Jagad), [Rodel Ituralde](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde), [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne), [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and several Aiel chiefs. He is trying to get Altara and Murandy to cede land to Illian so the Council of Nine will not invade both countries. He is also trying to expand Amadicia's borders into parts of Ghealdan. His headquarters is in Amadicia, and he rules there even above [King Ailron](#King-Ailron), although this is not spoken of openly. Niall recently offered a treaty with [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) of Andor, offering Whitecloak assistance to retake her throne in exchange for Whitecloak presence in Caemlyn and elsewhere in Andor, a presence that Morgase had not allowed even a fraction of during her reign.

name: Lord Captain Eamon Valda
info: A Lord Captain of the Children of the Light. He commanded the troops that were near Tar Valon, and gave [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred) the information on the Whitecloaks when he said he was curious. Once Galad joined the Whitecloak army, Valda promoted him quickly because of his swordsmanship skill, claiming that he deserved recognition for his skill regardless of where he obtained it. Valda thinks that [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall)'s time as Lord Captain Commander of the Children of the Light is coming to an end—his skill as a military commander earned him the right to have the position as long as he has, but Valda thinks he is getting too old to be effective. Valda plans to succeed him himself, but letting others know of this would undoubtedly mean a dagger through Valda's ribs, so he keeps it to himself.

name: Lord Carlomin
info: Commander of the Leopards, a subdivision of the Band of the Red Hand.

name: Lord Culen
info: Cairhienin lord who tries to strangle [Olver](#Olver) for sitting on his partner [Paers](#Lord-Paers)'s horse. He and Paers were dealt with by [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon).

name: Lord Culhan Carand
info: Andoran lord, husband of [Aemlyn](#Lady-Aemlyn-Carand). His house is nearly as powerful as [Lord Pelivar](#Lord-Pelivar-Coelan)'s.

name: Lord Davram t'Ghaline Bashere
info: Lord of Bashere, Tyr, and Sidonia; Guardian of the Blightborder; Defender of the Heartland; Marshal-General to [Queen Tenobia](#Queen-Tenobia-si-Bashere-Kazadi) of Saldaea. He is also her uncle. He is [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s father. He has black eyes, a beak-like nose, and a mustache. He is also slender, and shorter than most men. He left Saldaea with an army to hunt down [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim) after he escaped, and ended up in Caemlyn when [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) defeated [Rahvin](#Rahvin). He now commands Rand's troops in Caemlyn (those that cannot channel and are not under the command of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) or one of the Aiel chiefs).

name: Lord Dobraine Taborwin
info: Cairienin lord.

name: Lord Edorion Selorna
info: Young Tairen lord. He is plump and pink, and has become harder and tanner since he left Tear. He used to play cards with [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) in the Stone of Tear, and always reacted to his cards the same way—as if he had received all low cards and none matched.

name: Lord Elegar
info: Thin-lipped, nervous Andoran Noble. He is a Darkfriend.

name: Lord Estean Andiama
info: Son of [High Lord Torean](#High-Lord-Torean-Andiama) of Tear. He used to play cards with [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) in Tear. He came out to meet [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) near Cairhien, and now travels with Mat and the Band of the Red Hand.

name: Lord Estevan
info: Lanky Lord of the Land in Tear, sworn to [High Lord Sunamon](#High-Lord-Sunamon-Haellin).

name: Lord Gaebril
info: Man who came to Caemlyn just as riots sprang up throughout the city. He joined and led the faction that restored order in the city, and upon [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s return, he gave her her kingdom in one piece, as it was when she left. Allegedly, she was so happy that he had done this that she made Gaebril her new advisor. However, during [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s trip through Caemlyn to deliver [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s letter, Mat overheard Gaebril ordering someone to kill Elayne and anyone else with her—he tried to find a way to report this information to Morgase, but ended up telling Elayne. Gaebril was discovered to be [Rahvin](#Rahvin), one of the Forsaken, who has a preference to having pretty women around him. His “pretty woman” is Morgase, and he planned to wrest control of Andor from her. Morgase realized he was controlling her and left the country so quickly a rumor sprang up that she had been killed; when Caemlyn was taken by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and Rahvin killed, the rumor changed to say that Rand had killed Morgase, instead of Gaebril.

name: Lord Gareth Bryne
info: Former First Prince of the Sword and Captain of the Queen's Guards under [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) in Andor. He was appointed to the position because Morgase had no living male relatives, but was exiled from Caemlyn on a suggestion from Morgase's new advisor, [Lord Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril). He moved to his private estates in rural Andor, where he presided over the trial of three young women who unintentionally burned a barn: they turned out to be [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), the former [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat); [Leane Sharif](#Leane-Sharif), the former [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles), and [Min Farshaw](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw). When these three made an oath to serve him and then apparently broke it, he followed them out of sheer curiosity to Salidar. Once their, he discovered the true identity of the three, as well as that the Tower was truly broken. The Aes Sedai in Salidar persuaded him to command the army they would need to take the Amyrlin Seat from [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan), since he was the only commander that the Warders thought would be willing and able to help them. He is one of the six best military commanders west of the Aiel Waste, in a league with [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall), [Rodel Ituralde](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde), [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), [Agelmar Jagad](#Lord-Agelmar-Jagad), and [Matrim Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). Although neither of them would admit it, Bryne seems to be developing feelings for Siuan Sanche; he wishes to avoid another mistake like his relationship as [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s lover, and also never forgave Siuan for when she publicly shamed him years ago.

name: Lord Henren
info: Blocky, bald, hard-eyed Andoran noble.

name: Lord Jarid Sarand
info: [Elenia](#Elenia-Sarand)'s husband. A square-faced man, he is dark for an Andorman. During the Succession, Jared's House opposed [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand); after she became Queen, he was only allowed into the Palace on state occasions. When [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) killed [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril) and took control of Caemlyn until he could find [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), Jarid tried to make himself fall into favor, thinking he could gain power with the new ruler.

name: Lord Lir Baryn
info: A “whip of a man” who always wears a sword. He was one of the nobles who opposed [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Slender and strong.

name: Lord Luan Norwelyn
info: Andoran noble, leader of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled him from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion, but hopes he will still support her when she comes to claim the throne.

name: Lord Luc Mantear
info: Son of [Queen Mordrellen](#Queen-Mordrellen-Mantear) of Andor and brother to [Tigraine](#Lady-Tigraine-Mantear). [Gitara Moroso](#Gitara-Moroso), then advisor to the Queen, told him that his fame—or his fate—lay in the Great Blight. He disappeared from Andor into the Blight shortly before [Tigraine](#Lady-Tigraine-Mantear) disappeared, and was never seen again.

name: Lord Macharan
info: Andoran noble, of a minor House.

name: Lord Maringil
info: Cairhienin lord. He has white hair to his shoulders, is blade thin, and icy cool.

name: Lord Meneril
info: One of [Semaradrid](#Lord-Semaradrid-Maravin)'s countrymen. He has a scar on his face that he obtained during the Cairhienin civil war.

name: Lord Meresin
info: A lord who commands part of the Band of the Red Hand.

name: Lord Nalesean Aldiaya
info: One of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s subcommanders in the Band of the Red Hand. He is a blocky man, taller than [Talmanes](#Lord-Talmanes-Delovinde) or [Daerid](#Daerid). He leads the other half of the Band of the Red Hand's cavalry. He keeps a pointed black beard.

name: Lord Nasin Caeren
info: White-haired Andoran noble with a gaunt, narrow face.

name: Lord Paers
info: Cairhienin lord who tries to strangle [Olver](#Olver) for sitting on his horse. He and his partner [Culen](#Lord-Culen) were dealt with by [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon).

name: Lord Pelivar Coelan
info: Andoran noble, leader of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled him from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion, but hopes he will still support her when she comes to claim the throne.

name: Lord Ramsid
info: One of [Graendal](#Graendal)'s stunt artists. He is the brother of [Alsalam](#King-Alsalam-Saeed-Almadar), the king of Arad Doman.

name: Lord Rodel Ituralde
info: The commander of Arad Doman's army. He is one of the six best military commanders west of the Aiel Waste, in a league with [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall), [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne), [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), [Agelmar Jagad](#Lord-Agelmar-Jagad), and [Matrim Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon).

name: Lord Semaradrid Maravin
info: Highest-ranking Cairhienin lord that survived the battle.

name: Lord Sergase Gilbearn
info: Andoran noble, of a minor House.

name: Lord Talmanes Delovinde
info: A Cairhienin military commander, about three years older than [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and about a head shorter. His _con_ is three yellow stars on a blue field. His banner is a black fox. He rarely smiles, and reminds Mat of a compressed spring. He commands about half of Mat's cavalry in the Band of the Red Hand.

name: Lord Taringail Damodred
info: A Prince of Cairhien and First Prince of the Sword of Andor until his death. His first wife, [Tigraine](#Lady-Tigraine-Mantear), the then Daughter-Heir of Andor, bore him a son, [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred), before she vanished, causing the War of Succession. After the war was over, he married [Morgase Trakand](#Morgase-Trakand), the new Queen. Taringail and Morgase had two children, [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand) and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand). He died when Elayne was barely old enough to remember him, which was probably fortunate for Morgase; unbeknownst to her, he had planned to engineer her death and make himself the first King of Andor in a millenium. His real dream was to see his son sit on the Sun Throne of Cairhien and his daughter sit on the Lion Throne of Andor.

name: Lord of Chaos
info: Entity that controls all things in chaos. It could refer to [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), the [Dark One](#Dark-One), or chaos in general. The phrase is “let the Lord of Chaos rule,” and comes from a chant in the Fourth Age. It is also the subject of the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s command to the Forsaken: “Let the Lord of Chaos Rule.”

name: Lord of the Morning
info: Title by which [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) was known during the War of the Shadow. It is used for [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) sometimes despite his frequent cringing when it is used—he likes to keep his associations with the dead hero to a minimum.

name: Luaine
info: A Maiden of the Spear with yellow hair. She is the first to find out that [Sulin](#Sulin) has decided her period of servitude is over.

name: Lucilde
info: Lanky novice brought to Salidar from Tar Valon. She announces [Halima](#Halima-Saranov)'s arrival to [Delana](#Delana-Mosalaine) and company.

name: Madoc Comadrin
info: A general long dead. [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) remembers reading his book in a past life; he doubts a copy exists today. He met him once, or at least his ancestor did, about six hundred years before [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing) was born, after Mat's ancestor lost a battle to him.

name: Maerion
info: Name by which [Birgitte](#Birgitte) was known by in past lives.

name: Magla Daronos
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah.

name: Mahiro Shukosa
info: [Rafela](#Rafela-Cindal)'s Warder. He has graying hair at his temples and a “noble” nose. He was once a Kandori lord, and is handsome in a rugged sort of way.

name: Maira
info: A red-haired Maiden of the Spear. She is about ten years older than [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Malind
chapter: Chapter 35: In the Hall of the Sitters
info: Plump Sitter for the Green Ajah in Salidar. She has a pretty face with full lips and dark eyes.

name: Malindhe
info: One of the Wise Ones.

name: Manal
info: The owner of the ferry [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) hires to take him across the River Alguenya on the way out of Cairhien.

name: Mandelain
info: Clan chief of the Daryne Aiel.

name: Manel Rochaid
info: One of [Taim](#Mazrim-Taim)'s students in the Black Tower.

name: Mangin
chapter: Chapter 17: The Wheel of a Life
info: Aiel of the Jindo Sept of the Taardad Aiel. He was one of the Aiel who came to the Stone of Tear when it fell. He is taller than [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), and has gray eyes. He killed a Cairhienin man who had a dragon tatooed on his arm in imitation of a clan chief's; he was hanged in accordance with Rand's law in Cairhien. He placed the noose around his own neck, and turned _himself_ in.

name: Manna
info: _This is a typo; they meant [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani). This error does not appear in the hardcover edition of the book; it was made during the transcription to the paperback edition._

name: Mar
info: One of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s scouts for the Band of the Red Hand. He was taken right off his horse by a Warder near Salidar.

name: Marce Eldin
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: Stocky girl from Emond's Field. She is fond of reading. She comes with [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin) and [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani) to become Aes Sedai.

name: Marel
info: [Charel](#Charel)'s twin sister. She was instrumental in dismantling [Theodrin](#Theodrin-Dabei)'s block.

name: Marewin
info: One of [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s attendants in Amador. Slight and young.

name: Maric
info: A _very_ tall man who tries to stop [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) from seeing [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Marigan
info: Identity assumed by [Moghedien](#Moghedien) in order to slip in amongst [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara)'s refugee women in Salidar. None save Nynaeve, [Birgitte](#Birgitte), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), [Leane](#Leane-Sharif), and [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) know that the necklace she wears is actually an _a'dam_, a device used to control her so she cannot do the things Forsaken usually do.

name: Marisa Ahan
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: Pretty girl from Emond's Field. She comes with [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin) and [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani) to become Aes Sedai.

name: Masema Dagar
info: The [Prophet](#The-Prophet-of-the-Dragon). He was once one of [Uno](#Uno-Nomesta)'s underlings, and the one who respected [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) the least, but after he found out that Rand was the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), he went his own way, preaching of Rand's glory as the “Lord Dragon Reborn.” _For more on what Masema has become, read page 433 (612) of _The Fires of Heaven.

name: Mashadar
info: The evil that consumed Aridhol, now called Shadar Logoth, during the Trolloc Wars. It can kill simply by making contact with its victims.

name: Masic
chapter: Chapter 51: The TakingChapter 52: Weaves of the Power
info: A large man, killed in a knife fight in Ebou Dar.

name: Master Aydaer
info: Carpenter from Emond's Field who makes furniture.

name: Master Hornval
info: Tile-maker from Tarabon who came to Emond's Field after the battle with the Trollocs. His trade produced previously unheard of competition with [Cenn Buie](#Cenn-Buie)'s thatch, causing some friction.

name: Master of the Blades
info: The next step up from Swordmaster among the Sea Folk. He protects the Mistress of the Ships.

name: Masuri Sokawa
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She grew up in Arafel. Part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Matrim (Mat) Cauthon
info: A young man from Emond's Field. He is _ta'veren_. Along with his good friends, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), he left home to escape the Trolloc attack on Winternight. On the way to Tar Valon, he picked up a dagger from Shadar Logoth tainted with the evil that destroyed Aridhol, which he carried with him for a long time. He was separated from the dagger by Aes Sedai Healing, but doing so caused large gaps in his memory sequence. These gaps were filled and more when he passed through the twisted door to the land of the Eelfinn, where he was granted his three requests: a foxhead medallion that protected him from women's channeling, a way out of the land of the Eelfinn, and the memories of past lifetimes that were the gaps in his memory. Mat's _ta'veren_ qualities manifest themselves particularly well with random events, such as dice games—he almost never loses a toss of the dice, even if the dice are weighted. He has found that battles are the ultimate form of gambling, and along with his newfound memories he can win almost every battle he fights quite decisively. He has four sisters, including [Eldrin](#Eldrin-Cauthon) and [Bodewhin](#Bodewhin-Bode-Cauthon), who are 16 and 17, respectively. His father [Abell](#Abell-Cauthon) is one of the best archers in the Two Rivers, possibly in the World. Mat has gotten in the habit of carrying concealed knives under his clothes in case he is attacked—his collection would surprise anyone. In the Waste, he met a woman named Melindhra, a Maiden of the Spear from the Shaido Clan. However, she is not the [Daughter of the Nine Moons](#Daughter-of-the-Nine-Moons), who Mat is destined to marry according to the Aelfinn; besides, she tried to kill him on orders from her master among the Darkfriends. Mat had to kill her to save his own skin, but regrets it deeply. He has a scar along his neck from where the Eelfinn tried to kill him—which was also in accordance with what the Aelfinn told him, that he is “to die and live again.” He currently heads an army called the Band of the Red Hand, after the army of King Aemon of old Manetheren, and serves in a way as Rand's personal general—this works well, since Mat seems to be a better general than even [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), who has earned his good reputation as one of the best commanders alive. Mat does not trust any Aes Sedai, and because of this refuses to take his foxhead medallion off even to bathe.

name: Mayam
info: Aes Sedai of unknown Ajah. She arrived in Cairhien apart from the original six-Aes Sedai embassy.

name: Mazrim Taim
info: False [Dragon](#Dragon-Reborn) who wreaked havoc in Saldaea before being captured by Aes Sedai. He later escaped his captors, possibly with Black Ajah assistance (although this is totally unconfirmed). Hearing of [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s amnesty, Taim came to Caemlyn and became the head of Rand's school of male channelers. He is almost as strong in the One Power as Rand is. Taim claims to have held off the madness that normally accompanies the taint for almost 35 years—he has been using the One Power for a very long time, and knows many tricks that Rand had not thought of on his own or been taught by [Asmodean](#Asmodean), such as how to test men for the ability. He seems to resent being second to Rand.

name: Melaine
info: Wise One of the of the Jhirad sept of the Goshien Aiel. She is a Dreamwalker, and was one of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s teachers. She can channel. She swore she would never love a man, but changed her mind later and married [Bael](#Bael), her clan chief, thus becoming sister-wife to [Dorindha](#Dorindha). She has sun-colored hair and green eyes.

name: Mera
info: Older Aiel, in Cairhien to see her daughter.

name: Merana Ambrey
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah who grew up in Caemlyn. Leader of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) in Caemlyn.

name: Merilille Ceandevin
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. Slender and palely elegant, she has glossy black hair and large liquid eyes. She grew up in Cairhien. She was sent to Ebou Dar to convince the queen to support Salidar.

name: Mervin
info: Man from [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s school in Cairhien. He is working on a steam engine.

name: Mesaana
info: One of the Forsaken. During the Age of Legends, Mesaana was told she was unfit to do research at the Collam Daan, but was capable of teaching others. She spent her years teaching until the Bore was opened and she dedicated her life to the [Dark One](#Dark-One). During the War of Power, she created “schools” for the children, at which she taught the children to spy on their parents and other such things. After her release from the Bore, Mesaana set herself up in the White Tower, where she could control events without anyone suspecting she was behind them. She has been cooperating with [Semirhage](#Semirhage) to some extent.

name: Miesa
info: Serving woman to [Delana](#Delana-Mosalaine).

name: Mil Tesen
info: A peddler who meets with [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand) in his camp and brings him the rumor of [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s death.

name: Milam Harnder
info: Second-Librarian in the Royal Palace in Caemlyn. He has been one of [Demira](#Demira-Eriff)'s agents for the past thirty years.

name: Milla al'Azar
info: Woman from Taren Ferry.

name: Miren
info: [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw)'s aunt, the only one who understood that it was too late to stuff Min into dresses after ten years in the mines with her father wearing boys' clothes.

name: Mistress Snoot
info: Imaginary persona applied to anyone being snooty, such as [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), to [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s estimation.

name: Mistress of Novices
info: The Aes Sedai who is in charge of training novices in the White Tower. The post was held by [Sheriam Bayanar](#Sheriam-Bayanar) until a coup that deposed [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) chased her out of the Tower. The post is now held by Silviana Brehon in Tar Valon and [Tiana Noselle](#Tiana-Noselle) in Salidar.

name: Mistress of the Ships
info: The leader of the fleet of Sea Folk ships, similar to a fleet admiral.

name: Modrellein
info: Misspelling of [Mordrellen](#Queen-Mordrellen-Mantear), Queen of Andor before [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand).

name: Moghedien
info: One of the Forsaken. Her name means “Spider” in the Old Tongue. She always works and attacks from safety and will run unless she can do so. She developed a command of _Tel'aran'rhiod_ that surpassed even [Lanfear](#Lanfear)'s mastery—in the real world, Lanfear was more powerful, but even she could not top Moghedien in the World of Dreams. After being released from the Bore, Moghedien eventually found herself in Tanchico, in the Palace of the Panarch of Tarabon. While there, she chanced upon [Nynaeve al'Meara](#Nynaeve-al-Meara), who was trying to save the Panarch at the time and take the seal on the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s prison from its hold in the Palace. She and Nynaeve fought in a duel to the last, and Nynaeve managed to better Moghedien, much to the surprise of both of them. She managed to escape Nynaeve's tied off shield, and on their next encounter, this one in _Tel'aran'rhiod_, she ripped [Birgitte](#Birgitte)'s soul out of the World of Dreams after Birgitte almost killed her. On her third encounter with Nynaeve, Nynaeve managed to trap Moghedien with an _a'dam_. Moghedien is currently bound by that _a'dam_ in Salidar, disguised as [Marigan](#Marigan).

name: Moiraine Damodred
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. Born of a noble House in Cairhien, she is [Taringail Damodred](#Lord-Taringail-Damodred)'s youngest half-sister, and [King Laman](#King-Laman-Damodred)'s niece. She is considered short among her people, and the Cairhienin are already a short people. When it was discovered that she had the ability to channel inborn, Moiraine went to Tar Valon to become an Aes Sedai. Just before being raised to the shawl, she and her friend [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) witnessed [Gitara Moroso](#Gitara-Moroso)'s Foretelling of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). Moiraine and Siuan walked away from each other and did not speak to each other again (at least in public), but both held secret communication with each other and dedicated their lives to finding and guiding the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). Moiraine found the young man she sought on Winternight in Emond's Field, a young man named [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), along with two more _ta'veren_, [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) and two women with the spark of the Power inborn, [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere) and [Nynaeve al'Meara](#Nynaeve-al-Meara). When Moiraine was shortly raised to the shawl, she met [al'Lan Mandragoran](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), the uncrowned King of Malkier, who was fighting alone against the Shadow in the Blight; she asked Lan to become her Warder, and he accepted. She is very strong in the Power, stronger than almost all living Aes Sedai. In the Stone of Tear, Moiraine confronted and killed the Forsaken [Be'lal](#Be-lal) with balefire, just before he would have killed Rand. Later, after having an inkling of the future events from the testing _ter'angreal_ for the Wise Ones, Moiraine managed to push the Forsaken [Lanfear](#Lanfear) through the twisted doorway _ter'angreal_. Other Aes Sedai consider her a legend, not only for discovering the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) but for defeating two of the Forsaken as well.

name: Mora
info: Wise One of Colrada Hold when [Bair](#Bair) was first learning the dream. She told Bair that it was possible to be drawn into someone's dreams by simply acknowledging them if the emotion involved was so strong it left little room for anything else.

name: Mordeth
info: Man who became a counsellor in Aridhol during the Trolloc Wars. He advised that to defeat the Shadow, Aridhol must be harder than the Shadow, less trusting, more cruel. Slowly it became so, until finally the city was, if not darker than the Shadow, as dark. The city finally turned on itself, consumed itself, tainting every grain of sand, every rock, every sip of water with its hatred. Mordeth's soul remained in the city, now called Shadar Logoth (“Where the Shadow Waits”) for millenia—he could not leave the city unless he accompanied a person to the city walls or had them carry something from the city to the outside world. Strangely enough, both of these things happened at the same time, when [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) carried the ruby-handled dagger from the city while [Padan Fain](#Padan-Fain) accompanied Mordeth out of the city at about the same time. Mordeth attempted to consume Fain's soul while the dagger tried to consume Mat's. In Fain's case, the attempt to consume his soul was not completely successful—instead, the two souls merged to create something more evil than either Mordeth or Fain alone. Fain now feels incomplete without the tainted dagger that was removed from the city.

name: Morel
info: [Dal](#Dal)'s father, [Haman](#Elder-Haman)'s grandfather.

name: Morgase Trakand
info: By the Grace of the Light, Queen of Andor, Defender of the Realm, High Seat of House Trakand. Mother of [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand). She married [Taringail Damodred](#Lord-Taringail-Damodred), a prince of Cairhien, to further solidify her claim to the Throne of Andor; when [Tigraine](#Lady-Tigraine-Mantear) disappeared, Morgase made the best claim to succeed her, and married her widower to gain the support that would be gained by such action. Taringail died when Elayne and Gawyn father; he died when they were young. Morgase has since gone through several lovers, including [Thomdril Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin), a former court-bard; [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne), her First Prince of the Sword and Captain of the Guards; and most recently [Lord Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril), a man who led the faction that stilled the riots in Caemlyn that sprang up on Morgase's trip to Tar Valon to inquire about Elayne's whereabouts. Thom was exiled from the city of Caemlyn when he started telling her what he really thought of some of her plans, her relationship with Bryne ebbed away until finally Gaebril told her to exile him too, and Gaebril eventually chased Morgase herself out of the city when she found he was usurping her power. The Daughter-Heir of Andor is traditionally trained by Aes Sedai in the White Tower, and Morgase underwent novice training to keep the tradition alive. She was given the gift of a Great Serpent ring despite not being Accepted, and still wears it on her left hand. She was previously advised by [Elaida a'Roihan](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) of the Red Ajah, who is now the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). When Morgase discovered that Gaebril meant to usurp her throne, she left, and when she learned that the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) had taken over Caemlyn and none of her former supporters would give her aid, she fled to Amadicia to get help from the only place she thought she could: [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall) and the Children of the Light. She is not aware that [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) only wants to give her country back to her, not to mention believes that she is dead. If she made her presence known, she would no doubt have her country back in one piece and all would be well, but as royalty she believes she must work on her own and trust no one. The entire world believes Morgase dead except for a select few, all of which are in Amadicia at the moment.

name: Morning Clouds
info: One of the younger male wolves. He scouts out the Aes Sedai encampment.

name: Morvrin
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She is stout, and has graying hair. She is one of the six sisters who controls much of the action in Salidar, despite not being part of the Hall of the Tower.

name: Muad Cheade
info: Former Marshal-General of Saldaea. [Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere) says he was “mad as a hare in spring thaw”—he searched his bodyservant twice a day for poison, and drank nothing but vinegar and water (which he claimed were sovereign against the poison he was being fed). He once had a grove of oaks chopped down because they were looking at him the wrong way, and then insisted that his troops give them decent burials and funerals as well. However, he never lost a battle, so his insanity was tolerated.

name: Mulinda
info: Skinny serving woman who gets trapped under her bed by the bubble of evil that sweeps through Salidar.

name: Musar
info: Man who tried to kill [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim) while he still called himself the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). Taim let him live, and sent him back to [Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere).

name: Myrelle Berengari
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah with an elliptical face. She is young, and has three Warders named [Nuhel](#Nuhel-Dromand), [Croi](#Croi-Makin), and [Avar](#Avar-Hachami), all of which she treats as husbands in defiance of all law and custom, inside the tower and out. She fled the White Tower when [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) was deposed, along with most of her Ajah. She is one of the six sisters who hold much of the power in Salidar despite not being part of the Hall of the Tower.

name: Nae'blis
info: The one who would stand only a step below the [Dark One](#Dark-One) on the Day of Return, commanding all Darkfriends in the Dark One's name. The position has been promised to [Demandred](#Demandred) if he does well in his duties, but it is likely that _all_ the Chosen were offered the position if they did well.

name: Nan Belman
info: One of [Padan Fain](#Padan-Fain)'s spies. She is [Perwyn](#Perwyn-Belman)'s mother. Fain tries to seduce her, but she does not want him—he ends up raping her instead.

name: Nandera
info: A sinewy Maiden of the Spear with graying blonde hair. She points out [Sulin](#Sulin)'s use of handtalk with _gai'shain_; she agrees to meet her _toh_ to them as soon as [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) is safe.

name: Narasim Bhuran
info: Ruler who tried to declare himself High King as late as ten years before the end of the War of the Hundred Years; he was the last to do so. He was ultimately beheaded.

name: Natti Cauthon
info: [Abell](#Abell-Cauthon)'s wife, [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s mother. She and two of her daughters were arrested by the Whitecloaks as Darkfriends because of [Fain](#Padan-Fain)'s suggestions that Mat was a Darkfriend before [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) led the residents of the Two Rivers to drive the Trollocs and Whitecloaks out.

name: Negara
info: Andoran noble, of a minor House.

name: Nerim
info: [Talmanes](#Lord-Talmanes-Delovinde)'s servant. He is short for even a Cairhienin, and skinny, with gray hair and a long face. He mends his master almost as often as his master's clothes.

name: Nesune Bihara
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah, part of [Coiren](#Coiren-Saeldain)'s embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) in Cairien. She grew up in Kandor.

name: Niande Moorwyn
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah, former advisor (until his assassination...) to [King Galldrian](#King-Galldrian-su-Riatin-Rie) of Cairhien.

name: Nicola Treehill
info: Slender, black-haired, dark-eyed novice; she is about [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara)'s age. She was a refugee from Ghealdan.

name: Niella
info: [Aviendha](#Aviendha)'s first-sister; she is about six or seven years older than Aviendha. Niella is a weaver, taken _gai'shain_ by Chareen Maidens during a raid on Sulara Hold. She serves for about another six months. She tried to talk Aviendha out of taking up the spear, and has always wanted to see her married. She learned that Aviendha and [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) were alone together (though she did not know any details) while the two were on the far side of the world—Aviendha had made a Gateway to flee Rand after he walked in on her while she was in the bath. She inferred, correctly as it turns out, that the two were intimate, and immediately spread the word, much to Aviendha's later embarrassment.

name: Nildra
info: Stick-like gray-haired woman in charge of the scrub room in Salidar.

name: Nisao Dachen
info: Aes Sedai of Yellow Ajah. Her eyes could drive nails. She specializes in the study of diseases of the mind, diseases which traditional Healing cannot touch.

name: Norowhin
info: Commander of [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s “escort” in Amadicia. He hates pretending not to be a Whitecloak for her.

name: Nuhel Dromand
chapter: Chapter 51: The TakingChapter 52: Weaves of the Power
info: One of [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari)'s Warders.

name: Nynaeve al'Meara
info: Young woman from Emond's Field. She was the Wisdom of her village, the youngest ever chosen in Emond's Field. She left when four of her villagers were taken away from the Two Rivers by [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) and [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran). While the group traveled away from her home and toward her new life, Nynaeve made several discoveries: she could channel the One Power, and had already done so without really knowing what she was doing; she developed feelings for al'Lan Mandragoran, Moiraine's Warder and the uncrowned king of the now dead nation Malkier; and she has a major role to play, as all of her younger friends in the group do, in the years to come. She is very strong in the One Power; only a select few who were alive during the Age of Legends could match her. When she arrived in Tar Valon, she was raised Accepted without any tenure as a Novice, despite not being able to even _sense_ the True Source unless angry, a result of her having to learn some minimal control of her ability without teaching. She was sent on a false mission by [Liandrin](#Liandrin) on which she was almost leashed by the Seanchan as [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) was. After she returned to the Tower, [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) sent her on a mission to hunt down Liandrin and her fellow Black Sisters; while hunting them in Tanchico, she encountered [Moghedien](#Moghedien) and managed to better her in a duel of the Power. Moghedien escaped, but two encounters later Nynaeve once again managed to get the better of her, leashing her with an _a'dam_ in _Tel'aran'rhiod_. Nynaeve took Moghedien with her to seek out [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Rahvin](#Rahvin) while they were fighting each other, and at the last moment before Rahvin might have won, she nearly burned Rahvin to ash with a giant weave of fire that was most of what Moghedien could draw to produce it; the distraction was enough for Rand to regain control of himself and destroy Rahvin with balefire. Nynaeve now keeps Moghedien under control with a modified _a'dam_ in Salidar. Nynaeve wishes to become Aes Sedai for the sole purpose of Healing; she thinks the Tower meddles in the affairs of nations far too much, and wants no part of it. She is determined to Heal anything short of death, from severing to the wound on Rand's side. Nynaeve felt bad when [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) died, because her first thought was not of her, but that now Lan was free from their bond. She was not told that Lan's bond had been passed to another at the moment of her death, or who that person is.

name: Old Deer
info: One of the wolves.

name: Olver
info: A boy of nine who sat on the wrong horse and almost had his neck broken for the trouble. He is adopted after a fashion by [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and his Band of the Red Hand. His parents were killed when the Shaido ravaged Cairhien.

name: Osan'gar
info: Name given to the reincarnation of one of the Forsaken. It was the left-hand dagger in a form of dueling popular right after the creation of the Bore. The sport fell from common practice, since almost invariably both duelists died from the slow poison on the daggers. Osan'gar states that he helped make the Trollocs.

name: Osana
info: One of [Graendal](#Graendal)'s “pets.” She has to clean up the remains of [Rashan](#Rashan) after [Sammael](#Sammael)'s Traveling gateway cuts him in two.

name: Owein
info: One of [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani)'s Warders; he died in the Two Rivers when scouting out the Whitecloaks' campsite.

name: Padan Fain
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: Former peddler who frequently came to Emond's Field. A Darkfriend, he was given orders to locate the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) and narrowed it to three boys in Emond's Field. While persuing them, he encountered the spirit of [Mordeth](#Mordeth) in Aridhol, now called Shadar Logoth. Mordeth attempted to consume Fain's soul, but instead the two souls merged, producing something more evil than either of them alone. Fain no longer takes his orders from the Shadow; he has his own evil agenda. He has used his Mordeth-derived powers to spread suspicion of [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) to [Elaida a'Roihan](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan), the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) in Tar Valon, and [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall), Lord Captain Commander of the Children of the Light.  It is said, “The look of the Eyeless is fear,” from observing that a Myrddraal's look causes fear in the hearts of men. Fain's look has that effect on Myrddraal—Fades feel the same fear of Fain as men feel from a Fade. Fain is also called Ordeith, a name he adopted to become a Whitecloak officer. He is perhaps the most evil man alive.

name: Padry
info: A man who serves [Culen](#Lord-Culen) and [Paers](#Lord-Paers). He comes to assist them after their rub with [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon).

name: Paitr Conel
info: A young boy from Andor who comes to meet [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) in Amador. He was one of the many Darkfriends who found [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) on their way to Caemlyn due to the evil of Mat's dagger from Shadar Logoth. He was apparently one of the few people the Whitecloaks were correct about.…

name: Peral Torval
info: One of [Taim](#Mazrim-Taim)'s students in the Black Tower. He tries to confront [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) at the farm, not realizing who he is.

name: Perrin Goldeneyes
info: Nickname given to [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) by people in the Two Rivers; they chose it because of his wolf-like eye color.

name: Perrin t'Bashere Aybara
info: A young man from Emond's Field. He is _ta'veren_. When he and [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) got separated from the rest of the group while fleeing the Trollocs on Winternight, Perrin met a man named Elyas Machera. Elyas, a former Warder who found he could talk to wolves, helped Perrin discover the same ability in himself. Perrin's eyes are now yellow, just like the wolves' eyes, and he can enter what he calls the Wolf Dream (known to most as _Tel'aran'rhiod_, the World of Dreams) with them. Perrin is a childhood friend of fellow _ta'veren_ [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). On the way to Tear, Perrin encountered a young woman by the name of [Zarine Bashere](#Zarine-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara), a Hunter for the Horn who took the name of [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara) (which means “Falcon” in the Old Tongue) as a more appropriate name for a Hunter for the Horn. The two are now married. Perrin is a very large man—he was always a big person, which caused him to be very cautious since he found as a child that he could easily hurt other children if his temper got out of hand. His size helps considerably when helping [Master Luhhan](#Haral-Luhhan) on his forge, but sometimes gives others the impression that he is slow and stupid. He is currently in the Two Rivers, helping to rebuild the area after the series of Trolloc attacks; he and his wife serve as Lord and Lady there, the first lord of the Two Rivers since the Trolloc Wars.

name: Perwyn Belman
info: One of [Padan Fain](#Padan-Fain)'s spies. He is quite young. He is [Nan](#Nan-Belman)'s son.

name: Pips
info: [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s sturdy brown gelding.

name: Prince of the Dawn
info: Title by which [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) was known during the War of the Shadow. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) uses it when being introduced to the Andoran nobles who supported [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) in order to make them accept who he is.

name: Queen Alesinde
info: Queen of Andor after [Ishara](#Queen-Ishara-Maravaile). She kept up the practice of sending a daughter to Tar Valon for training.

name: Queen Alliandre Maritha Kigarin
info: Blessed of the Light, Queen of Ghealdan. She is the fourth person to sit on the throne of Ghealdan in the past seven months. She wears jewelry to her meetings with [Masema](#Masema-Dagar) for the sole purpose of giving it to him such that he will not ask for anything more; she also sent a letter to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) offering him her friendship and asking for his help.

name: Queen Ishara Maravaile
info: The first Queen of Andor, and wife of [Souran](#General-Souran-Maravaile). She governed the Province of Andor until [Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing)'s empire finally fell apart and Andor became an independent nation. All of the Andoran nobles are related to her somehow, although most people would not even consider the ones who hold the closest relation to her to be related at all. None of her sons lived past age twenty, hence the tradition of only having a queen in Andor. Her parents were [Endara Casalain](#Endara-Casalain), the governor of the province of Andor under Artur Hawkwing, and [Joal Ramedar](#King-Joal-Ramedar), the last king of Aldeshar.

name: Queen Lyndelle
info: Queen of Andor at the end of the War of the Hundred Years. Like all of her predecessors (and successors, for that matter), she kept up the tradition of sending a daughter to Tar Valon.

name: Queen Maragaine
info: A queen of Andor. During her reign, four kings brought armies against Andor.

name: Queen Mordrellen Mantear
info: By the Grace of the Light, Queen of Andor, Defender of the Realm, etc. before [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand). Her death and the previous disappearance of her daughter [Tigraine](#Lady-Tigraine-Mantear) set off the Succession, called the Third War of Andoran Succession by those not from Andor.

name: Queen Telaisien
info: Queen of Andor starting about sixty years after the death of [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing).

name: Queen Tenobia si Bashere Kazadi
info: Queen of Saldaea, niece of [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), and cousin of [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara). [Alviarin](#Alviarin-Freidhen) thinks that the fact that her army is moving is a sign that she does not trust the Aes Sedai to deal with the escaped false Dragon [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim).

name: Queen Tylin Quintara Mitsobar
info: By the Grace of the Light, Queen of Altara. Her kingdom is small, and she only rules a portion of it; the rest is governed by nobles not necessarily loyal to her. She is the second from her House to sit on the throne—this is the maximum traditionally, and the only House to hold it for four generations fell so fast from power that it could not recover. She is advised by [Merilille Ceandevin](#Merilille-Ceandevin) of the Gray Ajah.

name: Rabbit Nose
info: Young, fierce male wolf.

name: Radlin
info: An Ogier. He was [Serden](#Serden)'s grandfather and [Kolom](#Kolom)'s father.

name: Raefar Kisman
info: One of [Taim](#Mazrim-Taim)'s students in the Black Tower.

name: Rafela Cindal
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. She grew up in Tear. Part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Rahvin
info: One of the Forsaken. He was fond of using Compulsion, and was known for being a ladies' man—he always had a woman on his arm. After being released from the Bore, he took up residence in Caemlyn as [Lord Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril), and used Compulsion to have [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) not only make him her advisor, but her lover as well. He eventually planned to take over the country directly as the first ever King of Andor—he did his best to weaken support for Morgase, exiling her supporters and befriending those who opposed her, finally chasing her from the country as well. Shortly after news of Morgase's death or at least abdication reached Cairhien, Rahvin was confronted and killed by [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) in _Tel'aran'rhiod_ with a weave of balefire strong enough to burn Rahvin's soul out of the pattern for hours, possibly days.

name: Rajar
info: One of the Younglings.

name: Rana
info: One of [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw)'s aunts.

name: Rand al'Thor
info: A young man born in Emond's Field in the Two Rivers, now proclaimed to be the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). He is very tall, with curly red-blond hair. He was raised by [Tam al'Thor](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor) and his wife [Kari](#Kari-al-Thor) (until her death around the time Rand was five) in Emond's Field. His real parents, however, were [Janduin](#Janduin), the chief of the Taardad Aiel who brought the four clans across the Dragonwall to punish [Laman](#King-Laman-Damodred)'s Sin, and a Maiden of the Spear named [Shaiel](#Shaiel), who was actually [Tigraine Mantear](#Lady-Tigraine-Mantear), the runaway Daughter-Heir of Andor. Tigraine gave birth to Rand on the slopes of Dragonmount, in accordance with prophecy; “born of a Maiden, of the ancient blood but raised by the Old.” Rand has a heron branded into each of his palms, which he received from the sword Tam gave him while fighting [Ishamael](#Ishamael). He also has two dragons on his forearms, which he recieved in Rhuidean to designate him as the [Car'a'carn](#Car-a-carn), the Chief of Chiefs of the Aiel. He is not only the Dragon Reborn, but also [He Who Comes With the Dawn](#He-Who-Comes-With-the-Dawn), the man prophesied to reunite the Aiel, and the [Coramoor](#Coramoor), the one prophesied to bring the Sea Folk out of the Sea. He can channel strongly, more so than any person who ever lived (except the previous user of his soul, [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon), who was obviously of equal strength), and is also _ta'veren_, the most strongly so since Lews Therin as well. Lews Therin's voice has somehow found a new place inside of Rand's head; he talks to him in a mad voice when Rand least expects it, sometimes offering sound advice or knowledge, sometimes babbling, sometimes even trying to wrest control of _saidin_ from him. Unlike Lews Therin, Rand is accompanied by two other _ta'veren_ during this turing of the Wheel, two men born within days (hours, even) of him named [Matrim Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), who both grew up in Emond's Field as well. Rand is destined to fall in love with three women (and has): [Min Farshaw](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw), [Elayne Trakand](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Aviendha](#Aviendha). He has already been born on the slopes of Dragonmount of a Maiden, of the ancient blood but raised by the old, taken the Stone of Tear and drawn _Callandor_, and began conquering “under the forgotten symbol,” that of the Aes Sedai of the Age of Legends. He is working on having the “spotless tower” break and bend knee to him, as well. He is the salvation of the entire world, and as the prophecy states, he _will_ save the world—and Break it again.

name: Raolin Darksbane
info: False [Dragon](#Dragon-Reborn) who declared himself from 335–336 years after the Breaking of the World. His armies beseiged Tar Valon in an attempt to rescue him, an attempt which met with extreme failure.

name: Rashan
info: One of [Graendal](#Graendal)'s “pets.” He was sliced in two by the gateway [Sammael](#Sammael) used to return to Illian.

name: Rashima Kerenmosa
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah, later raised to the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). She is called the Soldier Amyrlin. Personally leading the Tower's armies, she won innumerable victories during the Trolloc Wars. Her body was discovered after the battle of Maighande surrounded by her five Warders and a large number of Trollocs and Myrddraal, including no fewer than nine Dreadlords.

name: Reene Harfor
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: First Maid in the Royal Palace in Caemlyn.

name: Rhadam Asunawa
info: High Inquisitor of the Hand of the Light. He wants every woman affiliated in any way with the White Tower hanged as of yesterday, every book that mentions Aes Sedai or the White Tower burned, and the very words banned.

name: Rhea Avin
info: Pretty, round-faced woman from the Two Rivers. She has dark hair that she has had braided for four years, and is about five years older than Faile. She and [Sharmad Zeffar](#Sharmad-Zeffar) are fighting over [Wil al'Seen](#Wil-al-Seen).

name: Rhuarc
chapter: Chapter 17: The Wheel of a Life
info: Tall, broad-shouldered, blue-eyed clan chief of the Taardad Aiel. He has gray streaks in his red hair. He has two wives: [Amys](#Amys), a Wise One, and [Lian](#Lian), roofmistress of Cold Rocks Hold. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) put him in charge of Cairhien along with [Berelain](#Berelain-sur-Paendrag-Paeron)—they have their disagreements, but overall it is working.

name: Rissen
info: One of [Vilnar](#Vilnar-Barada)'s men. He claims Aes Sedai are a foot taller than any man.

name: Rodera
info: A _gai'shain_ who serves one of the Wise Ones.

name: Roidan
info: Head of the _Sha'mad Conde_, the Thunder Walkers, east of the Spine of the World. He is of the Salt Flat sept of the Nakai Aiel. He has gray hair with some yellow in it, a hard face, and icy blue eyes.

name: Romanda Cassin
info: Eldest of the Sitters in Salidar and Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. Her hair is solid gray. She has a high soprano voice.

name: Ronde Macura
info: Dark-haired seamstress from Mardecin. She is one of the eyes-and-ears for the Yellow Ajah. [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) spotted the Yellow Ajah's signal outside her shop, and when she and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) went inside, Ronde drugged them with forkroot tea. She was going to send them off to Tar Valon as per the orders she was given until [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) and Juilin rescued the two women.

name: Ronelle
info: One of the Accepted. She gets trapped in her bedsheets when the bubble of evil sweeps through Salidar.

name: Saeric
info: Gray-haired Aiel of the Red Water sept of the Goshien Aiel. He is missing his right hand. He teaches Aiel methods of defending one's self to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s amnesty recipients.

name: Salita Toranes
info: Dark-skinned Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She is from Tear, and is almost as dark as the Sea Folk.

name: Samalin
chapter: Chapter 35: In the Hall of the Sitters
info: Sharp-faced Sitter for the Green Ajah in Salidar.

name: Sammael
info: One of the Forsaken. During the War of the Shadow, he was one of the Shadow's greatest military commanders. His name means “Destroyer of Hope” in the Old Tongue. After being released from the Bore, he took up residence on the Council of Nine in Illian as [Lord Brend](#Lord-Brend), and effectively rules the country. He bears a battle scar that he got while fighting [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) during the War of the Shadow. He could have had it Healed, but kept it to remind himself of what Lews Therin had done to him. He is about a hand shorter than [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Sanduin
info: Strapping True Blood with a scar on his face. [Sorilea](#Sorilea) suggests him as a husband for [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere).

name: Sarena
info: Altaran noble who comes to hear [Logain](#Logain-Ablar)'s story. She has a thin scar across her cheek.

name: Sarene Nemdahl
info: Aes Sedai of the White Ajah. She has a temper, but she will admit she is wrong if she is. She taught novice classes on “the nature of reality.” Her Warder is [Vitalien](#Vitalien). She has a secret love of writing poetry—she would die of shame if Vitalien ever discovered that she compares him to a leopard and other graceful, powerful animals in her poems. She was one year behind [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) and [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) in her Tower training.

name: Satina
info: Plump woman who gets trapped under her bed by the bubble of evil that sweeps through Salidar.

name: Sebban Balwer
info: Personal secretary to [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall). He has knobby shoulders and skinny legs. He believes nothing he is told. The post is actually a ruse; the pinch-faced man is actually the Master of Spies for the Children of the Light, and the Spymaster presented to the world is just a decoy.

name: Selande Darengil
info: Young woman who [Colavaere](#Lady-Colavaere-Saighan) tried to use to seduce [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Semirhage
info: One of the Forsaken. During the Age of Legends, she was one of the best Healers ever known. She was called to all corners of the world Heal people that others thought beyond help. However, she was sadistic; she exacted a price in the form of pain from her subjects in return for her Healing services. Most thought the pain or anguish she exacted from them was a small price to pay for being alive, but eventually the Hall of Servants found out about her practices and gave her the choice of being severed or bound with the Power, never again to know her “pleasures.” She chose instead to pledge for the [Dark One](#Dark-One), and created one of the most oppressive and pain-filled areas of Shadow control during the entire War of Power. After being freed from the Bore, Semirhage went in service to the Dark One by extracting information from captured Borderlanders and Aes Sedai. She also sent the Trollocs to the Stone of Tear to battle those that [Sammael](#Sammael) sent. She is as tall as most men, and wears black most of the time—perhaps because [Lanfear](#Lanfear) always wore white.

name: Seonid Traighan
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She grew up in Cairhien. Part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Serden
info: Ogier, son of [Kolom](#Kolom) son of [Radlin](#Radlin). He wrote approximately six hundred years ago about the deterioration of the Ways.

name: Serenia Latar
info: [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) long ago. She was the only Amyrlin that the Children of the Light managed to hang; she was dead already, but they hanged her anyway for the symbolism some 693 years ago. There is a painting of her being raised on the scaffold in the Dome of Truth.

name: Setalle Anan
info: Stately innkeeper of the Wandering Woman, the inn [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) stays at in Ebou Dar. She has hazel eyes, marking her a non-native to Ebou Dar.

name: Sevanna
info: A Wise One of the Shaido Aiel (recently inducted), and acting chief of the Shaido Aiel after [Couladin](#Couladin)'s death. She is the widow of [Suladric](#Suladric), the last official chief of the Shaido Aiel; after he died, she married the self-appointed, unofficial chief of the Shaido, Couladin.

name: Seve
info: Alleged son of [Marigan](#Marigan). Along with [Jaril](#Jaril), he was taken off the street by Marigan and treated as her son to take some suspicion away from her in case anyone suspected her true identity. When Marigan's true identity was found out, Jaril and Seve were taken in by other women in Salidar.

name: Shadowkiller
info: What the wolves call [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). They first began using the name when [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) killed the Trollocs at the Illuminators' chapter house in Cairhien.

name: Shai'tan
info: The Dark One, source of all evil, complete opposite of the [Creator](#The-Creator) in every way. At the moment of Creation, the Dark One was imprisoned by the Creator at Shayol Ghul. This prison kept the Dark One from touching the world until it was bored into by humans during the Age of Legends. This hole, called the Bore, allowed the Dark One to once again touch the world, causing new outbreaks of war, treachery, violence, and crime. The attempt to free the Dark One completely resulted in the War of the Shadow (called the War of Power by some, especially those on the Shadow's side), during which a number of important leaders forsook the Light and gave their lives to the Dark One; these people are known today as the Forsaken, and were 13 of the most powerful Aes Sedai of the Age of Legends. The War of the Shadow did not end until [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon), the Dragon, and his Hundred Companions Traveled to Shayol Ghul and re-sealed the Dark One back into his prison. At the moment of sealing, Shai'tan lashed out at those sealing the prison, driving them insane and tainting _saidin_ itself, the male half of the True Source, dooming all male Aes Sedai to madness as well and starting the Time of Madness. These seals are weakening now, enough that the Forsaken have escaped and the Dark One is once again able to exert influence on the world. These seals were scattered throughout the world by Aes Sedai during the Breaking of the World.
