In order of when they were found, they were placed: (1) At the Eye of the World (broken when it was found); (2) in the hands of Bayle Domon, later pilfered by High Lord Turak of the Seanchan (broke at the battle of Falme), (3) On Seanchan, part of High Lord Turak's collection (broken at the battle at Falme); (4) In the Great Hold at the Stone of Tear (still intact); (5) In the Panarch's Palace in Tanchico (broke enroute to Salidar); (6) One in Rhuidean (still intact), and (7) Found by [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim) (still intact). Despite being made of _cuendillar_, the three that remain unbroken can be cut with a knife and would break by a fall from a table. The Dark One is also referred to by other Euphemisms, including Sightblinder, Lord of the Grave, Father of Lies, Grassburner, Leafblighter, Heartsbane, Soulsbane, Lord of the Twilight, Father of Storms, Shepherd of the Night, and (among Darkfriends) Great Lord of the Dark.

name: Shaidar Haran
info: Myrddraal of special abilities who escorts the Chosen (i.e., Forsaken) to the Pit of Doom to converse with the [Dark One](#Dark-One). He is head and shoulders taller than all other Myrddraal, who are the height of an average man and all the same height. His name means “Hand of the Dark” in the Old Tongue; most Myrddraal names come from the Trolloc tongue. He is given special consideration; the ceiling of the entrance to the Pit of Doom does not brush his head as it does everyone else's.

name: Shaiel
info: [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s biological mother. She chose the name herself, never giving another to the Aiel who met her. It means, “Woman who is Dedicated.” She abandoned a son she loved and a husband she did not because [Gitara Moroso](#Gitara-Moroso) told her disaster would strike Andor and the world if she did not become a Maiden of the Spear, telling no one. After a year she was adopted into the Chumai sept of the Taardad Aiel. Shaiel became pregnant during the Aiel War, and gave birth to a son, after which she died. Later, Rand found that Shaiel's true identity was [Tigraine](#Lady-Tigraine-Mantear), the Daughter-Heir of Andor who disappeared without a trace.

name: Shana
info: Pop-eyed Aes Sedai of the White Ajah. She reminds [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) of a fish.

name: Shandin
info: [Ledar](#Ledar)'s father, [Koimal](#Koimal)'s son.

name: Shanelle
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She is present at the Healing of [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) and [Leane](#Leane-Sharif).

name: Shaofan
info: Man who was to marry [Chiape](#Chiape) and become Sh'botay of Shara before [Graendal](#Graendal) captured him as one of her “pets.”

name: Sharmad Zeffar
info: Coppery-skinned, plump woman who came to the Two Rivers after the Trolloc attacks subsided. She fled Arad Doman when the Seanchan attacked Almoth Plain and civil war broke out in her homeland. She and [Rhea Avin](#Rhea-Avin) are fighting over [Wil al'Seen](#Wil-al-Seen).

name: Shemerin
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah, reduced to Accepted by [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) against all Tower law. She ran away from the Tower after being reduced. Shemerin was one of the Aes Sedai who personally saw to [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche)'s removal from office.

name: Sheriam Bayanar
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah with fiery hair. She was [Mistress of Novices](#Mistress-of-Novices) in the White Tower before she fled to Salidar with the rest of her Ajah. She leads the group of six sisters that hold most of the influence in Salidar, despite not being part of the Hall of the Tower. Her tilted, green eyes can be used to intimidate novices and Aes Sedai alike.

name: Shimoku
info: Pretty, dark-haired Kandori who became Accepted just before the Tower divided.

name: Siuan Sanche
info: Born in Tear to a fisherman, she was sent to the White Tower on the first boat to leave after she discovered she had the ability to channel inborn, according to Tairen law. As a novice, she was good friends with [Moiraine Damodred](#Moiraine-Damodred), and was present at [Gitara Moroso](#Gitara-Moroso)'s Foretelling of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). After being raised to the shawl, she joined the Blue Ajah to dedicate her life to finding and guiding the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), and eventually came to lead the Blues' network of eyes-and-ears (i.e., spies) before being raised to the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). She was only thirty years old when raised to the Amyrlin Seat, making her the youngest Amyrlin to date. When her lifelong connection to the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) was discovered, she and her [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles), [Leane Sharif](#Leane-Sharif), were deposed and stilled by a group of sisters loyal to [Elaida a'Roihan](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan). Siuan hopes to regain some of her previous standing in the new Tower that has separated from Elaida—her knowledge of the Blue Ajah spy network is hard to match, and she knows much that she thinks would be of use. In one of her viewings, [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) saw that Siuan would have to remain close by to [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne)—if she did not, both of them would die. Siuan did not initially know what she meant, but now realizes that she is growing to love the gray-haired man who leads the Salidar army. She had a Warder named [Alric](#Alric), but he died when she was deposed.

name: Somara
info: Yellow-haired Maiden of the Spear. She is the tallest of those that make up [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s honor guard.

name: Soong
info: [Ella](#Ella)'s mother, [Soong](#Soong)'s grandmother.

name: Sora Grady
info: [Jur](#Jur-Grady)'s wife. She is afraid of what her husband can do. The Gradys have a four year old son.

name: Sorilea
info: Wise One of Shende Hold, of the Jarra sept of the Chareen Aiel. She has thin, white hair; tight, leathery skin; and green eyes. She can channel, but weakly. She is about a head taller than [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere). She is the strongest-willed of the Wise Ones—even other Wise Ones scurry to do her bidding.

name: Stayer
info: [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s second horse. He is well-shod with white forefeet.

name: Stepper
info: [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s dun stallion.

name: Stevan
info: [Demira](#Demira-Eriff)'s Warder, a Cairhienin. He is slender, about a head shorter than her, and twenty years her younger.

name: Suladric
info: Last true chief of the Shaido Aiel, and [Sevanna](#Sevanna)'s first husband. After his death, Muradin went to Rhuidean to become his successor and failed; [Couladin](#Couladin) then declared himself to be the chief of the Shaido despite being refused permission to enter Rhuidean. His death set off what may some day be called the Shaido War in Cairhien.

name: Sulin
info: Wiry, white-haired Maiden of the Spear. She leads the Maidens who make up [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s honor guard.

name: Surandha
info: [Sorilea](#Sorilea)'s apprentice. She can channel, and has dark golden hair.

name: Susa al'Seen
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: Slight, fluttery girl from Emond's Field. She had always been excitable. She comes with [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin) and [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani) to become Aes Sedai.

name: Swallow
info: [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s black mare.

name: Tabitha
info: A novice in Salidar. She comes to fetch [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) and [Juilin](#Juilin-Sandar) to bring them before the Hall.

name: Tabiya
info: Green-eyed, freckle-faced novice of about sixteen. She is part of the class that [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) teaches (the class went poorly). She is one of the eighteen novices that were snatched up and brought to Salidar.

name: Tad Kandel
info: One of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s men. He tried to hide a boil on his bottom.

name: Takima
info: A Sitter for the Brown Ajah in Salidar. She comes to verify [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara)'s Healing of [Logain](#Logain-Ablar).

name: Tamlin (Tam) al'Thor
info: [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s father. He taught Rand about the Flame and the Void, a trick he uses to concentrate and to win archery competitions; Rand found that it is the way he can gain access to _saidin_. Tam is not actually Rand's biological father; he found Rand as a newborn on the slopes of Dragonmount and took him home with him since Rand's mother was dead. He was at Dragonmount as part of the Aiel War, which he left home to participate in when he was young. He became an officer in the Illianer army, and even achieved Blademaster status, acquiring a heron-mark sword. He married a woman from Caemlyn, [Kari](#Kari-al-Thor), who he met while stationed there. When the Aiel War started, he fought Aiel all the way to Tar Valon and the Battle of the Shining Walls, where he found Rand on the mountain. Tam and Kari raised Rand as their own son. Tam always won the archery competitions (or came in second to [Abell Cauthon](#Abell-Cauthon)), and passed his archery skills on to Rand. He also taught [Aram](#Aram) how to use his sword. Tam had no idea that the child he was raising was the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn).

name: Taric
info: [Amaryn](#Amaryn)'s youngest greatson. [Sorilea](#Sorilea) suggests him as a husband for [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere).

name: Tarna Feir
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. She has pale yellow hair and blue eyes that could freeze the Sun. She was a wilder, and had her block beaten out of her by [Galina Casban](#Galina-Casban).

name: Tarva
info: Gray-haired Shaido Wise One; she is actually [Therava](#Therava), but [Coiren](#Coiren-Saeldain) could not remember it correctly and did not care.

name: Tell Lewin
info: [Dannil](#Dannil-Lewin)'s brother. He looks just like him except for a pickaxe nose and long thin mustaches in the Domani style.

name: Tervail Dura
info: Dark-haired, bold-nosed Warder with a white, deep scar on his face. He is bonded to [Beonin](#Beonin-Marinye). He was on guard at [Logain](#Logain-Ablar)'s door when [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) Healed him.

name: Teryane
info: Woman who [Vilnar](#Vilnar-Barada) wants to marry. He is the daughter of a merchant in Mihar (in Saldaea). She wants a soldier for a husband almost as much as her father wants one for a son.

name: Teryl Wynter
info: One of [Seonid](#Seonid-Traighan)'s Warders. She says he has taken wounds before that almost made her faint, but he has never slowed a step.

name: Teslyn Baradon
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. She was one of two Aes Sedai sent as ambassadors to [Queen Tylin](#Queen-Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar) in Ebou Dar.

name: Thad Torfinn
info: Skinny man from Emond's Field. He and [Jon Ayellin](#Jon-Ayellin) dispute the boundaries of their farms.

name: The Creator
info: The maker of the Universe, people, places, things, the True Source, everything in existence. An alternate name would be God. After He created the world, the Creator made a prison for [Shai'tan](#Dark-One), the Dark One, His complete opposite in every way, to keep him from influencing the world. The Creator is bent on non-interference—He will not directly influence events in the world, instead using a “Chosen One” or simply tugging at the Pattern of the Age in hopes that what He wants to occur will occur, instead of just making it happen. The Forsaken and most Darkfriends consider Him to be inferior to the Dark One, despite the fact that He imprisoned him.

name: The Dragon
info: Name by which [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) was known during the War of the Shadow. His rebirth, the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), is now alive and fulfilling all of the prophecies set to accompany him.

name: The Prophet of the Dragon
info: Title given [Masema](#Masema-Dagar) as the self-appointed bringer of the news of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). He is not necessarily sane anymore, but has gained a very large following. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) is getting to the point where he plans to do something about him, but he has not gotten around to it yet with all the other problems he faces.

name: The Spider
info: Nickname given to [Moghedien](#Moghedien), used by enemies and allies alike. The nickname refers to the name Moghedien, which was a highly venomous spider alive during the Age of Legends.

name: Theodrin Dabei
info: A former Accepted in Salidar, now raised to something higher than Accepted but lower than a full Aes Sedai (due to the absence of the Oath Rod). She is trying to dismantle [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara)'s block to channeling at will.

name: Therava
info: Gray-haired Shaido Wise One who comes with [Sevanna](#Sevanna) to make an alliance with the Tar Valon embassy.

name: Therille Marza
info: [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s personal tailor in Emond's Field.

name: Therva Maresis
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She is present at the Healing of [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) and [Leane](#Leane-Sharif).

name: Thomdril (Thom) Merrilin
info: A gleeman who came to Emond's Field on Winternight just before the Trollocs came. He is quite the ladies' man. Thom is good at juggling, sleight-of-hand, and all kinds of other tricks. He also carries several concealed knives up his sleeves, in his boots, and in various other locations on his body; this practice seems to have spread from Thom to [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw), and [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara). Thom was originally a bard in [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s Royal Court, and for a time after her husband [Taringail Damodred](#Lord-Taringail-Damodred) died, he was the Queen's lover. During his run from a Fade at Shadar Logoth, he was injured, and now walks with a limp because of it. Thom is getting old, such that he is starting to realize that he cannot do the backflips and other stunts he used to do. He accompanied [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) on their travels as per [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s request, despite the fact that he has never felt comfortable around Aes Sedai since his nephew, Owyn, was gentled by the Red Ajah. Thom is an expert in the Game of Houses; in fact, his girlfried Dena was killed by Cairhienin soldiers because they thought he was trying to play _Daes Daemar_ against the Royal House.

name: Tialin
info: Lean, red-haired Wise One with a sharp nose.

name: Tiam of Gazar
info: Person who proposed the Gazaran Calendar, which celebrated the alleged freedom from the Trolloc threat by recording Free Years (FY). This calendar was adopted due to the chaos the resulted during the Trolloc Wars and the resulting confusion as to which year it actually was under the Toman Calendar.

name: Tiana Noselle
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. She serves as [Mistress of Novices](#Mistress-of-Novices) in Salidar.

name: Timolan
info: Clan Chief of the Miagoma Aiel. When he was young as a chief, he tried to unite the clans and failed. Other chiefs thought he might be a little hesitant to follow a man who had succeeded in doing just that.

name: Tolvar
info: Misspelling of [Torval](#Peral-Torval). The mistake was corrected in the paperback edition.

name: Toma dur Ahmid
info: Person who devised the Toman Calendar, which was adopted approximately two hundred years after the death of the last male Aes Sedai and continued until the Trolloc Wars. The Calendar recorded years After the Breaking, or AB.

name: Tomas
chapter: Chapter 10: A Saying in the Borderlands
info: [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin)'s Warder. He is old and haggard, but still spry.

name: Toram Riatin
chapter: Chapter 17: The Wheel of a Life
info: Cairhienin noble vying for the Sun Throne in Cairhien; he is related to [Galldrian](#King-Galldrian-su-Riatin-Rie), the last king of Cairhien.

name: Torvil
info: Misspelling of [Torval](#Peral-Torval). _This mistake has been corrected in the paperback edition._

name: Torwyn Barshaw
info: [Paitr](#Paitr-Conel)'s uncle, a squat, big-nosed man with a choleric eye and a sneering mouth.

name: Trom
info: Whitecloak who allegedly uncovered the “Darkfriends” that were hanged in [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s presence.

name: Tumad Ahzkan
info: Heavy-shouldered, hatchet-nosed young soldier, a head taller than his commander [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere). He has a black beard and mustaches in the Saldaean style. He brings the news of [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim)'s arrival to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Two Moons
info: One of the wolves.

name: Uno Nomesta
info: A Shienaran officer who accompanied the Emond's Fielders away from Shienar. He is the one who gave orders to [Masema](#Masema-Dagar) in the past. He is missing one eye, has a long scar across his face, and has a hairstyle like the typical Shienaran warrior—a topknot tied together and the rest of the head shaved clean. He is currently in Salidar with [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand).

name: Uren din Jubai Soaring Gull
info: Sea Folk scholar and deviser of the [Farede](#Farede) Calendar, which measured dates from the arbitrarily set end of the War of the Hundred Years as years of the New Era (NE). This calendar is currently in use.

name: Urien
info: Red-haired Aiel of the Two Spires sept of the Reyn Aiel. He is _Aethan Dor_, a Red Shield.

name: Valinde Nathenos
info: Aes Sedai of the White Ajah. She is anxious to get [Sammael](#Sammael) out of her native Illian. Part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Vandene Namelle
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah, one of two Aes Sedai who went into voluntary retreat many years ago to Tifan's Well, a village located in the grassy plains of Arafel along with [Adeleas](#Adeleas-Namelle). Their goal was some day to write the complete history of the world since the Breaking, and some even before that. Vandene and Adeleas have since come to Salidar to escape [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan)'s summons back to the Tower.

name: Varadin
info: One of [Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall)'s best personal agents. He works as a wealthy merchant (formerly just a rug-seller, but he has done quite well) in Tanchico. He informs Niall of the _Hailene_, the Return of the Seanchan; Niall does not believe it.

name: Varilin
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah who almost killed herself by turning the stone she was trying to make a _ter'angreal_ out of into a ball of something like flame. If [Dagdara](#Dagdara-Finchey) had not been there, she would have died.

name: Verdin
info: One the soldiers loyal to [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara).

name: Verin Mathwin
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah who accompanied [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) back from Falme to Tar Valon. Her Warder is named [Tomas](#Tomas). She is more interested in current events than the average Brown; most of them could not care less what happened now, only what happened years ago. She gave Egwene the twisted stone ring _ter'angreal_ to assist her in Dreaming, and also once told [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) that there was really no need to keep her in the Tower until she learned to control her ability when she was a novice, since she would not ever be able to do much with it anyway. When Verin went to the Two Rivers with [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani), they helped to fight the Trollocs that attacked, and when they left they brought a half-dozen young women with them who could channel, including [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s sister [Bode](#Bodewhin-Bode-Cauthon). When she and Alanna reached Caemlyn, they found that the Tower had been broken, and decided to side with the Salidar embassy when it reached town. Verin is quite old—her hair is starting to turn gray, which to an Aes Sedai means she is quite old indeed.

name: Vilnar Barada
info: Bearded man from Saldaea. He plans to marry [Teryane](#Teryane), daughter of a merchant in Mihar. He is currently in Caemlyn.

name: Vitalien
info: [Sarene](#Sarene-Nemdahl)'s Warder. Unknown to anyone, she writes poetry comparing him to a leopard and other graceful, powerful animals; she would die of shame if he ever found out.

name: Voniel
info: Ogier, daughter of [Ella](#Ella) daughter of [Soong](#Soong). She is [Covril](#Covril)'s sister and [Haman](#Elder-Haman)'s wife.

name: Wil al'Seen
info: Man from Deven Ride who likes to flirt. He is [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s cousin. [Sharmad](#Sharmad-Zeffar) and [Rhea](#Rhea-Avin) are fighting with each other over him.

name: Wil
info: Hu's neighbor. He is a co-subject of a joke [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) tells the Maidens in an attempt to prove that in fact they are the ones who lack a sense of humor, not him.

name: Wildfire
info: One of the wolves.

name: Wildrose
info: [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw)'s horse.

name: Wile
info: _This is a typo; they meant [Elle](#Elle). This error does not appear in the hardcover edition of the book; it was made during the transcription to the paperback edition._

name: Wind
info: [Olver](#Olver)'s spindly horse. He may even deserve the name.

name: Young Bull
info: Name the wolves use for [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara). It is actually an image, one of the simplest ones in fact, but much more complex than simply “Young Bull.”

name: Yurian Stonebow
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) of an era before the Trolloc Wars. Six Aes Sedai attempted to capture him; he killed three of them and captured the rest himself.

name: Zaida din Parede Blackwing
info: Wavemistress of a Sea Folk ship who comes to Caemlyn to see [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). She is of Clan Catelar.

name: Zarine ni Bashere t'Aybara
info: Daughter of [Davram](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere) and [Deira](#Lady-Deira-ni-Ghaline-t-Bashere) Bashere. She gave up the name to become a Hunter for the Horn, adopting the name [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara) when she found out that Mandarb was taken—by [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran)'s horse.

name: Zenare Ghodar
info: Plump Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. In Salidar.

name: al'Lan Mandragoran
info: The uncrowned king of Malkier, and formerly Warder to [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred). He is quite tall, and does not get very emotional—in fact, he has emotional walls all around him that he has been building for years. His country, Malkier, was overrun by Trollocs shortly after he was born, and is now corrupted by the Great Blight. Lan, the last of his people, then proceeded to fight a one-man war against the Shadow by killing Shadowspawn in the Blight. He fought Aiel during the Aiel War, and achieved Blademaster status. He was eventually bonded by Moiraine, which ended his lonely fight (or at least changed its style). When Lan and Moiraine brought [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) out of their home in the Two Rivers, he found that there was something which could throw his guard down, but he was the last to notice it: affection for Nynaeve. As Moiraine put it, Nynaeve was able to plant vines in Lan's emotional walls and break them down without him even knowing they were there. He loves her very much, whether he admits it openly or not, and Nynaeve, to her surprise, loves him in return. Upon Moiraine's death, Lan's bond was immediately transferred to another Aes Sedai, and he was last seen leaving the wagons near Cairhien to seek her out.
